characters: IF ANYTHING HAPPENS TO ME, CALL MARCUS. 212 555 7407

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide shot in which you could be forgiven for failing to spot a tiny, brightly-clothed FIGURE on one of the roofto Over this, we hear the voice of our hero: DAVE LIZEWSKI.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I always wondered why nobody did it before me. I mean, all those comic books. Movies. TV shows... You’d think that one eccentric loner would have made himself a costume. We track in towards the figure: a YOUNG MAN IN A SUPERHER COSTUME. Perilously near the edge, striking an iconic pos With cool resolve, he slips a pair of GOGGLES into positi

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Is everyday life really so exciting, are schools and offices so thrilling, that I’m the only one who ever fantasized about this? He spreads his arms to reveal awesome MECHANICAL WINGS.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: C’mon. Be honest with yourself. Calmly, he dives off the roof.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: At some point in our lives, we all wanted to be a superhero. A smile on his face. A beautiful open vista of concrete a glass windows reflecting the low sun. He’s in flight. Oh wait... No he’s not. The smile fades. This isn’t flyin Just good old-fashioned falling.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Fuuuuuck! Below, pedestrians become aware of his impending approach Pointing and screaming. Camera phones. Running to safety. He lands on a PARKED CAR. It crumples like paper. The CAR ALARM strikes up over the crowd noise. We needn’t look cl to be sure that he’s dead. But what the hell. We track in

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That’s not me, by the way. That’s some Armenian guy with a history of mental health problems. On the news, his sister said he read about me in the New York Post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge, antiquated building. STUDENTS mill around outside CAR pulls up and out climbs highschool senior DAVID LIZEW Not quite Napoleon Dynamite, but not quite Zac Efron eith

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That's me. Back before any of this stuff happened. Back when you’d have to be a lot crazier than that guy to try and be like me. He waves to his father, MR LIZEWSKI, who is driving...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Later, Dad. ...And sets off towards the school entrance.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not saying there was anything wrong with me. Just that you’d have had a hard time finding a hook. (a beat) I mean, I wasn’t into sport... HE strolls past a brace of SOCCER-TEAM GIRLS kicking a ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave joins the back of a line of kids, all waiting to pas one by one through a METAL DETECTOR ARCHWAY.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wasn’t a mathlete... We move down the line to see three NICE KIDS ahead of him

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: or a hard-core gamer... Two BOYS. Their t-shirts say “AFK”, and “The cake is a li

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I didn’t have a piercing, or an eating disorder, or three thousand friends on MySpace. Four skinny, pierced EMOS stand at the front of the line.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I wasn’t funny. A chubby white guy, who we’ll come to know as MARTY, danc through the archway doing the “Soulja Boy” dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bell RINGS. Dave and the class scramble into their se

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Like most people my age, I just existed. Dave's teacher MRS ZANE, 40, comes in. A slightly chubby borderline milf. She takes off her jacket and hangs it up INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 5 Dave lies on his bed watching TV.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Kick in my bedroom door and you'd probably find me watching TV. Or talking to my friend Todd on Skype. Dave sits at his PC. On the screen: a You Tube page and, minimized window, the face of Dave’s best friend TODD.

dialogues.speaker: TODD, (ON THE SCREEN)
dialogues.text: You watching Family Guy?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TODD, (ON THE SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Me neither. The sound dips and we return to Dave's V.O.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Or jerking off. Mostly to my biology teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a replay of what we just saw, Mrs Zane takes off her jacket. Then she stares right at us and takes off her blo She reaches back to unhook her bra just as we cut to: INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 7 From our vantage point under Dave’s desk, we can see his PANTS around his ankles. A wad of SOILED TISSUES are drop into the WASTEPAPER BASKET by his feet.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Though, to be honest, it didn’t take much to set me off.  10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave’s COMPUTER SCREEN. A homework document headed “The Maasai tribe”, and a shot of some bare-breasted tribeswom He types: “...traditional ceremonial bead-work”. Then - sentence abandoned - the cursor clicks to minimise the document and bring the tribeswomen to the foreground. Another handful of tissues goes in the basket. Dave's playing WORLD OF WARCRAFT. His female NIGHT ELF is screen. The cursor fliesto and fro, removing all her clot Fingers moving urgently on the keyboard, Dave types “/dan The nearly-naked digital elf performs a sexy dance. Another tissue drops into the basket. A copy of TV GUIDE is tossed to the floor. Followed by another tissue.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I tell you, when my hormones balance out, shares in Kleenex are gonna take a dive, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we left off, Mrs Zane takes her seat and leans forw to put down her purse. She catches Dave looking at her ti

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ZANE
dialogues.text: Dave Lizewski. You might want to be looking at your textbook about now?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yes, Mrs. Zane. Sorry. She flashes a playful mock-stern frown, then an amused sm before looking away. Truth is, she’s flattered.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sure, a lot of what got me through the average school day was making deposits in the wack-off warehouse for later. But don’t get me wrong. I liked girls my own age, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave walks the crowded corridor, eyes fixed on a striking cute girl who is fumbling in her locker: KATIE DEAUXMA.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Especially Katie Deauxma.  11 Katie looks up and breaks into a broad smile.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Hey gorgeous!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey! Katie claps her hand over her mouth, and, hearing a bark laughter from behind him, Dave wheels round to see the pe Katie was actually addressing: her best friend ERIKA CHO.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No, you meant - Erika. I know. I knew that. You were... I was just kidding. I knew you didn’t...

dialogues.speaker: KATIE DAVE
dialogues.text: Oh god. ...mean me.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: That was...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: It’s cool. Ok then. See ya... later He hurries away. Behind him, Erika and Katie clutch each other in helpless laughter as Katie dies of embarrassment

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I was just a regular guy. INT. DAVE’S KITCHEN. DAY. 11 Dave sits at the table with his DAD, AND HIS MOM, 42. She eating cereal.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No radioactive spiders. No refugee status from a doomed alien world. Dave morosely pours himself a bowl of CORN PUFFS.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Know what? Todd said they do still make Count Chocula. They just don’t sell it at the A&P any more. Suddenly, Dave’s mom slumps forward onto the table. Her bowl of cereal crashes to the floor, the spilled corn puffs bouncing iconically towards us like the pearls from Martha Wayne’s broken necklace.  12 13

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My mother was killed by an aneurism in the kitchen, as opposed to a gunman in an alley. So if you were hoping for any... Close on the cereal box as it morphs into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A GRAVESTONE. Behind it, the New York skyline just vis through a fierce storm. Dave: dripping wet, fists aloft, raging at the heavens through the thunder and lightning.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I will avenge you, mother!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: +-.-You’re outta luck. The tombstone morphs back into... INT. DAVE’S KITCHEN. DAY. 13 -+-A box of COUNT CHOCULA cereal. Just Dave and his dad a the breakfast table now.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In fact, in the eighteen months since my mother died, the only epiphany I had was realizing that, like it or not, life just goes on. Dave studies the cereal box.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: They never had so many mallow pieces when I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: Hey, I have something for you. He hands Dave three MOVIE TICKETS. Dave lights up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Spiderman 8! Thursday?! The sneak preview?! Dad, you officially rock! Don’t you got a shift Thursday night?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: They’re for you and the guys.  14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fanboy’s dream. Two storeys of comic books, toys and collectibles, with a coffee-shop concession. Dave is here with Todd and Marty, chatting and drinking frappucinos.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: How come nobody’s ever tried to be a superhero?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Gee, I dunno. Oh wait, yeah I do. Cos it’s fucking impossible, dickwad.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What, putting on a mask and helping people? How is that impossible?

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: That’s not a superhero, though. How is that super? Super is like, being stronger than everybody and flying and shit. That’s just hero.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: It’s not even hero, it’s fuckin’ psycho.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hello? What about Bruce Wayne? He didn’t have any powers.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Yeah, but he had all expensive shit that doesn’t exist. I thought you meant, like how come no one does it in real life.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess I did mean that.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: C’mon. Anyone who did it for real would just get their ass kicked. They'd be dead in like, a day.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I’m not saying they should do it. I just can’t figure out why no one does. Seriously, out of all the millions of people who love superheroes, you’d think at least one would give it a try. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those mid-life crisis guys in the guitar store, they’re never gonna be rockstars, but it doesn’t stop ‘em buying guitars.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY TODD
dialogues.text: M (shrugging) Yeah, I guess. leh.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus, doesn’t it bug you? Why do thousands of people wanna be Paris Hilton, and nobody wants to be Spiderman?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, what’s with that? She has, like, no tits. None at all.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s the porn tape. He doesn’t have a porn tape.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: You never saw One Night in Spiderman? They all crack up. But suddenly, Todd is distracted.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Holy shit, check out the wheels. He nods over to the storefront window. A huge black stret S-class MERCEDES has pulled up outside.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Looks like Mr. D’Amico traded in the hummer.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Nah. He probably kept it. And has, like, both? A teenage boy climbs out - CHRIS D’AMICO, 17 and self- conscious. He shuffles in followed by a large BODY GUARD. Chris begins to browse a rack of comics, sneaking a look at Dave and his friends before looking hurriedly away.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Is it just me, or do you feel kinda sorry for Chris D’Amico?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Woah. Must suck to have a rich dad and everything you want. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MARTY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In fact, I wish you hadn’t brought it up. I think I’m gonna cry.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeh, but he’s always on his own.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: We should, like, talk to him. See if he wants to hang with us.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I wasn’t saying we should talk to him, just, like -

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: It'd be awesome! Think about it: if he was our friend, no one would ever fuck with us again! Dave and Marty consider this. Marty nods over towards Chr

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Go on then, Todd.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Nuh-uh. Dave should go.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Why? I just said I felt sorry - Aw shit, ok, fine. Dave makes his way over to the register, where Chris is n in line. Nearby, the Bodyguard pretends to read a comic. Chris sees Dave approaching and smiles. Dave smiles back an awkward wave. The bodyguard glances up from the comic.

dialogues.speaker: BODY GUARD
dialogues.text: Fuck off. This guy is massive. Dave does not need to be asked twice From Chris’ pov, we watch Dave return to his friends and enact the encounter. All three burst into laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Todd walk home, carrying their BAGS of new comic Then, from nowhere, TWO GANG KIDS block their path. The bigger kid holds out his hand matter-of-factly.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG KID
dialogues.text: Phones. Money.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Aw man, not again.  16 10. Dave hands over his phone and cash. Todd just gives cash.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG KID
dialogues.text: Phone.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: I don’t have one! Somebody else jacked it last week!

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG KID
dialogues.text: Gimme the bag.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: It’s just comics.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GANG KID
dialogues.text: You wanna get cut? Todd reluctantly hands over the bag of comics, and the ki walk away casually. Shaken and angry, Todd and Dave walk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRE FERNANDEZ, 30, unlikely to join his local neighbourho watch scheme any time soon, is tied to a chair, his finge in a pair of heavy-duty BOLT-CUTTERS held by a HUGE GOON. Several other goons surround him - let’s call them GINGER SCARY, SPORTY, BABY and POSH. And here’s FRANK D’AMICO, 5 and his right-hand man, BIG JOE. You know by the cut of Frank's suit that he’s in charge.

dialogues.speaker: TRE
dialogues.text: Frankie... Frank, I’m telling you, man. I swear I’m not making this up. This fucking guy... Comes outta nowhere -

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: This would be the guy who looks like Batman.

dialogues.speaker: TRE
dialogues.text: I didn’t say he looked like Batman.

dialogues.speaker: HUGE GOON
dialogues.text: You did, you said the guy looked like Batman.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GOON
dialogues.text: He said, like, a black mask and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: HUGE GOON
dialogues.text: And a cape.  17 18 11.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Like Batman.

dialogues.speaker: TRE
dialogues.text: I didn’t say ‘like Batman.’ I never said ‘Batman’.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So this guy, he comes in, outta nowhere. TRE. Right. Outta nowhere. Fucks us up real bad.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: And this is who killed Johnnie...

dialogues.speaker: TRE
dialogues.text: Right. And my two guys.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: ..-And jacked my coke.

dialogues.speaker: TRE
dialogues.text: He didn’t exactly jack it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hyper-stylized fantasy sequence. Tre lies on the floor with a gusher of a nosebleed, clutching a BAG OF COKE. TW DEAD CRONIES lie nearby. The last man standing is JOHNNIE - clearly the muscle. Tr watches in dismay as the even-bigger SUPERHERO steps behi Johnnie and slices his throat with a HUNTING KNIFE. The Superhero turns on Tre, who throws the bag of cocaine into his face, bolts for the open window and jumps out. T masked man, his black costume now covered in coke, watche out of the window as Tre limps away for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank fixes Tre with an impassive look.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: And this guy... This guy who killed everyone else, he doesn’t bother to follow you. Because?

dialogues.speaker: TRE
dialogues.text: Because, I don’t know. I swear Frank, I’m just telling you what happened.  19 20 12.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay. Let me explain the problem I got here, Tre. Our mole with the Russians tells it a bit different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another stylized fantasy sequence. A TALL RUSSIAN shows T BRIEFCASE full of CASH. A group of RUSSIAN HOODS look on. nods his approval and the tall Russian clicks the case sh and hands it over, in exchange for a large bag of coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tre reacts to what he’s just heard.

dialogues.speaker: TRE
dialogues.text: You're kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (re: the bolt cutters) Does it look to you like I’m kidding?

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Our guy said you gave them Russians a pretty sweet deal.

dialogues.speaker: TRE
dialogues.text: It’s a fucking lie, man! I can’t believe you believe this shit from a fucking Russian, man.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Let’s see, Tre. What’s more likely? You're a greedy little cocksucker, or my coke is missing because it wound up all over Superman’s face.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Batman.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HUGE GOON
dialogues.text: Batman’s face.

dialogues.speaker: TRE
dialogues.text: I never said Batman!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Oh for fuck’s sake. My son’s in the car, waiting to go to the movies. Joe, you're in charge.  21 22 13. He snaps his fingers as he turns to go. Joe nods. The hug goon snips the bolt-cutters closed. Tre screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can still hear the distant screams as Frank - shadowed Ginger Goon - climbs into the back of the waiting Merc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank gets in beside his son - Chris, who we met earlier and the bodyguard. Ginger Goon sits in the front.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sorry you had to wait, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I coulda waited inside. I’m sick of being treated like a kid.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We're not having this conversation again, Chris. (to the bodyguard) Where’s the driver?

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD
dialogues.text: Restroom.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: The movie’s starting in, like, 10 minutes. We can still hear screaming coming from inside the wareho studiously ignored by everyone in the car.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We're cool. It’s okay. We’re only gonna miss the trailers.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I wanted to, you know, get popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to the bodyguard) When we get there, get Chris some popcorn, okay? And bring it in. What do you wanna drink, Pepsi? Chris nods grudgingly. The screaming continues, escalates

dialogues.speaker: BODYGUARD
dialogues.text: You got it, sir.  23 24 25 14.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: And I’1l have an Icee. Mixed. Like, when they mix the red one and the blue one? The driver gets in. From inside the warehouse, we hear tw gunshots. Everyone but Frank flinches. Nobody mentions it

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And a pack of Twizzlers. Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo pulls up outside the theatre. A few people line for tickets as a huge tide of others flood out. Among the an elated Dave, Todd and Marty - talking excitedly about movie they’ve just seen.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The comic-books had it wrong. It didn’t take a trauma, or cosmic rays or a power ring to make a superhero. INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 24 Dave undresses. In his underpants, he really looks like j a little kid. The camera jibs down to see a UPS PACKAGE. From it, Dave pulls out: a WET-SUIT and a SKI MASK. He pulls them on and looks in the MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You are fucking awesome. He strikes a superhero pose, throws a few martial arts mo

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...dust the perfect combination of optimism and naivety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet MINDY MACREADY. 11 years old, and tiny. Wearing a wo hat, a padded jacket and an intense frown.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Daddy? I’m scared. Her father, DAMON, 35, is big and ripped and has a killer handle-bar moustache. But he’s softly spoken.  15.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: C’mon Mindy, honey. Be a big girl now. Nothin’ to be afraid of. We pull back to take in Damon’s full towering height. In hand is A GUN. He loads the magazine.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Is it gonna hurt bad?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Only for a second, sugar. (off her pout) Handgun bullet goes more than 700 miles an hour, so at close range like this, the force is gonna take you right off your feet, for sure. But it’s really no more painful than a punch in the chest. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: No. I hate getting punched in the chest.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You'll be fine, baby doll. Before she can protest, he releases the slide, takes the safety off, aims the gun at her and fires off a round. The bullet hits her square in the chest. She flies throug the air, landing on her back a couple of feet away.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not so bad, huh? She sits up stiffly and shrugs at him. Then she unzips he jacket to study the KEVLAR VEST underneath. She pokes her finger into the little dent left by the bullet.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now you know how it feels, you won't be scared when some junkie asshole pulls a glock.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Wouldn’a been scared anyways. Damon guffaws, pulls off her hat and ruffles her hair.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: That's my girl! ‘kay. Up you get. Couple more rounds, then home.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Only if we can go Ben and Jerry's on the way back.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Hmm. Okay. Two rounds, no wincing, no whining and you got yourself a deal, young lady. She gets up and faces him, arms outstretched, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get Phish Food and Chunky Monkey!

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Good call, baby! He takes aim and - BAM! - cracks off another round. INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. DAY. 26 Dave, wearing his costume, slips jeans and a long-sleeved over the top. He grabs his school bag and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Zane is at the whiteboard but Dave isn’t watching. He writes in his book, fingering the collar of his costume u his shirt, a sly smile playing on his lips. In Dave’s notebook are several heroic DOODLES of himself costume, and some names: Night Walker, Bad Night, Bad Ass He writes down: Kick Ass. Then a bunch of question marks. INT. BEN AND JERRY’S. DAY. 28 Mindy is here with Damon, scoffing a large core sundae. F sauce drips onto her padded jacket. She looks down to wip off and notices five bullet holes.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Daddy! Lookit!

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I know, honey. Good job! Hey, you had any more thoughts on what you want for your birthday?  29 30 31 17.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Mmmm. Can I get a puppy?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: (surprised) A... puppy? Like, a dog?

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Yeah. A cuddly fluffy one. Anda Bratz Moviestar Makeover Sasha. Damon looks like he’s about to have a seizure. Mindy spit ice-cream everywhere as she bursts into giggles.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just fucking with you daddy! I'd love a Benchmade model-42 butterfly knife. Damon joins in the laughter, relieved. EXT. D’AMICO’S APARTMENT BLOCK. DAY. 29 A black Lexus pulls up and a LIVERIED DOORMAN steps forwa to open the door. BIG JOE climbs out, nods his greeting t the doorman, and enters the building. INT. D’AMICO’S APARTMENT BLOCK - LOBBY. CONTINUOUS. 30 Inside, Big Joe greets a SECOND DOORMAN and walks towards bank of elevators. One is guarded by Scary Goon. Inside t elevator, Posh Goon ushers big Joe in and closes the door INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - KITCHEN. 31 A beautiful bespoke kitchen/breakfast room. Outside, an incredible view of Manhattan. Clearly, business is boomin Frank and Chris eat breakfast with Chris’s mother, ANGIE D’‘AMICO, 47 and looking good. Posh Goon pops his head round the door.

dialogues.speaker: POSH GOON
dialogues.text: Big Joe to see you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. (to Angie) Sorry hon. She rolls her eyes good-naturedly as she stands up, takin her bowl of oatmeal with her, and heads out of the room.  18.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: No problem. Chris?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (to Frank) I don’t mind you talking business. I'll just sit quiet. I should, like, start learning and stuff. Frank points at the door. Chris gets up and stomps out.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna be 18 in eight months for chrissakes. Frank ignores him and greets Joe, who gives Chris an affectionate slap on the back as he passes. Joe sits down

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS
dialogues.text: We got ourselves a problem, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: And here was me, thinking you broke up my family breakfast cuz you wanted to discuss last night’s Dancing with the Stars.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Our Russian says Tre just gave them another 5 K’s, half price.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Which Tre? Tre Tre? Tre Fernandez?

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Right. Tre Tre. Dead Tre.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So now I’m getting fucked in the ass by a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Or Tre was telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: This is my choice? I have to believe in ghosts or superheroes?

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Not the part about the superhero. Just that he mighta really been gaffled by somebody.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I think it’s time we invited our Russian friend over for a friendly chat. See what’s really going on.  32 33 34 35 19.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Put his balls in a vice?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Cool. I just wanted to double check. Cos there was that one time you said “friendly chat”, and you meant it literally, and I thought -

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I remember.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: So, better safe than sorry, y'know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, in his costume, carefully treads the edge of the ro

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'll be honest, there wasn’t a whole lotta crime fighting in those first few weeks. He reaches the corner and looks across to the next roofto He glances down into the narrow alleyway separating the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alley we looked down into before. Dave checks he’s no being watched, then runs a TAPE MEASURE between the walls

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But even so, my new vocation kept me plenty busy. I didn’t even have time for internet porn any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave has placed two pieces of wood that distance apart. H runs up to the first, leaps... lands nowhere near the sec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave pumps iron.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If my friends wondered what the fuck was going on with me, they never mentioned it.  36 37 38 39 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sits with Todd and Marty eating a plate of FISH, STE and BOILED EGGS. The guys don’t bat an eyelid. Marty poke eye holes in a piece of bread and wears it as a BANDIT MA INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 37 Dave poses in his costume, flexing his still-tiny pecs.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All I knew was I’d never felt so good about myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, back at his long-jump, makes several more unsuccess attempts before he finally lands clear of his target. Close on his feet as we see his subsequent landings past second piece of timber, getting further and further away.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I called it preparation. Finally, he takes a run up and we see that the pieces of timber have been put aside, and he is now going for the r thing. He reaches the edge of the roof... and stops.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But if you called it fantasizing, it woulda been hard to argue. INT. MINDY AND DAMON’S APARTMENT. DAY. 39 The kind of place you’d expect to see in a documentary ab scary-ass opt-out survivalists - boarded-up windows, a gu rack, not much furniture. Damon sits on one of several ME TRUNKS, grinning as Mindy admires a PAINTING. Now we see that it is a brilliantly rendered piece of com book artwork depicting them in costume, dynamically posed

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You like?

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I love! You’re the bestest comic artist, Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He beams and hands her a prettily wrapped PARCEL.  21.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: And here’s your proper present. Happy birthday, baby. Mindy tears it open and squeals: It’s the exact BUTTERFLY KNIFE she asked for. She flings her arms around Damon’s n

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you, thank you! She studies the knife and tentatively begins to attempt a traditional “flipping” moves. She succeeds surprisingly w

dialogues.speaker: MINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daddy, look! Damon applauds encouragingly until the blade accidentally slices the back of her hand. She stops and studies the cu

dialogues.speaker: MINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit. She wipes her hand on her jeans and starts flipping again

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Okay, pop quiz. What’s the proper name for one of those?

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Easy: “Balisong”. It’s Filipino. Ask me another.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Mmmm. ‘kay... The AR15 was a lighter, smaller calibre version of what design? She nicks her hand again. Wipes it, unperturbed. Continue

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Eugene Stoner’s AR10. Now gimme a hard one.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: When did Samuel Colt get his US patent?

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I said a hard one! February 25th, 1836.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: John Woo’s first full-length feature. Mindy’s knife flipping is getting ridiculously good now. times, the knife is just a silver streak in her little ha  40 4l 42 22.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Tie Han Rou Qing. The Young Dragons... Look, daddy, look! You're not looking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a junction, Dave wheels his bike beside Todd and Marty all carrying BAGS from the comic store. This is where the part company. Dave mounts up, waves goodbye and rides off He rides on, down the same shitty street we saw earlier. Nearby, two boys skulk by a car. The guys who mugged Dave Todd. One has a SCREWDRIVER. He looks up, stares at Dave.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Like every serial killer already knew, eventually fantasizing just doesn’t do it for you anymore. It was time to engage. Dave looks away, keeps pedalling, head down. But his spee gradually slows until, at the next alleyway, he stops dea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave chains his bike to a fire-escape. He tears open his shirt, revealing his costume underneath. This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first gang kid has his screwdriver wedged under the window rubber and is prying it off. His friend loiters nearby, smoking a JOINT and keeping lookout. They pause, utterly bewildered, at the sight of: Dave. Walking towards them in his full, costumed splendor.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GANG KID
dialogues.text: What... the... fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG KID
dialogues.text: The fuck are you looking at? Dave hesitates. They start to walk towards him.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG KID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I said what are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Two cheapshit losers screwing with a car that somebody probably worked their ass off to pay for.  43 44 23.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG KID
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: SECOND GANG KID
dialogues.text: Leave it man. Motherfucker be high.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I’m not high. I just think it sucks that you figure you can do whatever you want. Walk away from the car, and we can just forget about it. Without warning, the first kid steps up and punches Dave. Dave reels. But now we see that, behind his back, he has piece of LEAD PIPE. He cracks it over the kid’s head. The goes down, the screwdriver flying from his hand. A beat. Then the second kid sets on Dave. The pipe gives an initial advantage. But now the first guy is up again.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GANG KID
dialogues.text: Fuck this shit! You crazy, man! He pulls A KNIFE and, before Dave even realizes it, he’s stabbed in the gut. He looks down in disbelief. Then drop The gang kids run. Dave gets up and staggers to the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave stumbles into the road as A CAR approaches. He tries flag it, but the ALARMED FEMALE DRIVER accelerates past h Dave turns in disbelief to watch the car disappear into t distance... failing to see A SECOND CAR speed towards him ploughs into him, sending him flying like a rag-doll. The car slows and a terrified BUSINESSMAN stares out to s Dave is out cold, his legs and pelvis grotesquely twisted his costume covered in blood. The driver is in serious sh He looks around. No witnesses. Panicking, he speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fade up to Dave’s POV. A SIREN is wailing. A MEDIC is cutting off his costume. The medic shouts up to the drive

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: Back and responsive! (to Dave) Easy, pal. Take it easy. Don’t try to move.  45 46 24. Dave is in a neck brace, an oxygen mask over his face.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: My dad is gonna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: He’s gonna be happy you’re alive.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I need a favour. Please? Don’t tell anybody about the costume?

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: You got it. The medic deposits the shredded costume in the MEDICAL WA RECEPTACLE. Dave smiles with relief. Then his eyes roll b

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shouting to the driver) Losing him again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fade up to Dave’s POV: a blur of bright lights and concerned faces, as the hospital gurney speeds him along.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don’t remember a whole lot from the first days at the hospital. Just that the pain was a thousand times worse than anything I'd ever experienced. A nurse leans down with a needle.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And the morphine was a thousand times better. Dave lies in a hospital bed, bandaged and wired up, aslee Beside him sits his drained father, staring into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rather battered Russian, DANIL, 30, sits on a chair, ha tied behind his back. Nearby, Big Joe talks on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: They don’t have the vice here no more... No. They only treat the lumber here now... Yeah, but the thing they use for that is even better... Exactly... Okay, cool. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Huge Goon) Go ahead. The Huge Goon pulls Danil up and, followed by Joe, begins walk him across the warehouse, past piles of WOOD.

dialogues.speaker: DANIL
dialogues.text: Look, the guy tells me he is Tre Fernandez, what do I know? Now you say Fernandez is dead, so, okay, this guy, he lie about who he is. They arrive at a large INDUSTRIAL MICROWAVE OVEN, its doo open. The Huge goon punches Danil in the face and pushes inside. He bolts the door and studies the OPERATION PANEL

dialogues.speaker: HUGE GOON
dialogues.text: Does it have settings? Like on a regular microwave?

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: The fuck do I know? We’re not making a fucking Hungry Man dinner, just turn it on! Exasperated, Joe leans past the goon and hits the LARGEST BUTTON. A very loud WHIRR starts up. BIG JOE (CONT’D) (shouting to Danil) Who did you buy our coke from? And this time, don’t tell us somebody who's dead. Danil peers out, desperate, his hand cupped to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: HUGE GOON
dialogues.text: Can he hear you? I don’t think he can hear you.

dialogues.speaker: COKE
dialogues.text: Now Danil is in pain. We can faintly hear him shrieking. Big Joe begins to mime his question, one word at a time: open handed shrug... a “handing over” gesture... a point.

dialogues.speaker: WHO... SOLD... YOU...
dialogues.text: But before he can finish, there’s a popping sound, and - SPLAT - the viewing window is decorated with Danil’s insi

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit.  26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave lies in bed, awakening slowly from his sleep. In the chair where we last saw Dave's father, is his mother.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Mom? What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: David honey, you need to get better now. Your poor dad... First me then you? You really can’t go dying. Dave squeezes his eyes shut.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: This isn’t real.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: It’s not?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Nah. I don’t believe in ghosts. He opens his eyes. She’s gone, and in her place is a CHIN FAMILY in traditional rural dress - a MAN, a PREGNANT WOM and FIVE SMALL CHILDREN. The woman turns to her husband a whispers in Mandarin, subtitled.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE WOMAN
dialogues.text: He believes in reincarnation.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE MAN
dialogues.text: (to Dave, subtitled) You do know that statistically, there’s a one in three chance of coming back as a Chinese peasant? The woman rubs her belly and smiles ominously at Dave.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (in Mandarin, subtitled) Is that even true? If you’re just going on numbers, aren’t I more likely to come back as an insect or something? The Chinese family have gone. In their place, a GIANT SPI now sits in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT SPIDER
dialogues.text: You have a point, there.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Shit... I really don’t wanna come back as a spider.  48 27.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT SPIDER
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It’s just not really how I saw things going. Eating flies... fucking other spiders... The spider climbs onto the bed and straddles him.

dialogues.speaker: GIANT SPIDER
dialogues.text: Hey, don’t knock it ‘til you’ve tried it, baby. A doctor hurries into the room with Dave’s father. They r over to the bed, apparently unaware of the spider’s prese

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: (to the doctor) See? I think he’s... (to Dave) Dave? Can you hear me? The spider has gone, and Dave stares groggily at them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Dad? Mr. Lizewski’s face floods with joy and relief. He kisses Dave on the forehead, and Dave smiles weakly.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Welcome back, young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave lies on the bed, the X-RAY UNIT poised over his pelv There’s a whine and a flash as it takes a shot.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Turned out, I'd had, like, nine operations or something insane. The RADIOLOGIST enters and moves the unit for another sho

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I hurt all over. I felt weak...

dialogues.speaker: RADIOLOGIST
dialogues.text: Good job. You can get changed now. She helps Dave over to a small changing cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And coming off the morphine was a pisser...  49 50 51 52 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave takes off the patients gown, and begins to dress, ga absent mindedly around the cubicle at the various MEDICAL INFORMATION POSTERS. One detailing how to perform a BREAS SELF-EXAMINATION catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But all things considered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radiologist stands outside the door, looking concerne

dialogues.speaker: RADIOLOGIST
dialogues.text: Dave? Are you okay in there, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave deposits a handful of tissue into the MEDICAL WASTE

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .-.I was getting back to my old self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An X-RAY PHOTOGRAPH of a skull with a big metal plate in Now another - an arm with elaborate pins. Now a metal-stu leg. Dave studies these as, in the background, his dad pa away Dave’s hospital things into bag.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: How cool is this? I look like Wolverine.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: They still have that metal detector at your school?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I know! It’s gonna have a meltdown!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: (suddenly serious) Dave, I need to ask you something.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: The police report... They found you naked. You said you didn’t remember why. The muggers... they didn’t...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What? No! Jesus! I wasn’t even... In the ambulance, they had to throw my clothes away! Cos of the blood.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: Right... Because the medic said you were naked.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: But... Nobody...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Of course not!! Oh my god. Mr. Lizewski throws his arms round his son and starts sob with relief. Dave pats him awkwardly on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mindy walks alone, carrying a GROCERY BAG. A passing COP slows to a crawl beside her and a handsome African Americ cop, DETECTIVE MARCUS WILLIAMS, 37, winds down the window

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hey! You need a ride home? Mindy carries on walking, ignoring him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t be out on your own in the dark, you know. It’s not safe. Mindy shakes her head in amusement and keeps walking. EXT. MINDY AND DAMON’S APARTMENT. NIGHT. 54 Mindy lets herself in, unaware that she is still being watched from a distance by Detective Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave carries his tray - a burger and fries - trying to ig all the people staring or whispering. Katie looks at him she talks to Erika, then abruptly stops talking as he pas  56 30.

dialogues.speaker: ERIKI CHO
dialogues.text: Said he’s what?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: (not now!) Nothing. Perturbed, Dave takes his seat next to Todd and Marty. Ma punches him hard in the back.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Did you feel that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (bored of this) No.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: You're like fucking Jason Bourne or something! That owns! Marty does it again, harder.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: How about that time?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No. Marty, give it a fuckin’ rest, man. I’ve only been back, like, half a day and already you’re making me kinda miss the hospital. INT. MINDY AND DAMON’S APARTMENT. DAY. 56 A veritable arsenal of WEAPONS are spread out all over th room. Damon is at a makeshift drawing board, inking a pic we can’t see. Behind him a row of PORTRAITS are pinned to wall. All villainous-looking men, drawn in comic book sty Mindy walks in carrying two open cans of PROTEIN SHAKE. S hands one to Damon and takes a swig of her own.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Protein shake for ya. (re: the picture) Oooh. Another picture for our plan?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Yep. And I have something for you. He produces: a UTILITY BELT, bristling with LETHAL ITEMS.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Sweet! You got me a little one!  57 58 59 31.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Made it just for you, babydoll. Try it on? She does. It’s a perfect fit. Mindy inspects it eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Stun grenade, hand grenade, mace, shuriken... And... What’s this for? She scrutinises something on the back of the belt, near h behind. We can’t see what it is.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: It’s for... If all else fails. But only then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Dave’s POV, we gaze down into the now-familiar alley then across the chasm to the next roof.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I should have quit, of course. We see Dave: in a NEW COSTUME. He sprints towards the gap INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 58 Dave holds his phone above his head - the favoured flatte MySpace angle - and looks up. He snaps a shot of himself. On his computer we see the PERSONAL PAGE he’s made for Kickass. A few clicks and the photo he just took is in pl

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But you can’t just re-programme yourself: what you want, who you are... your purpose in life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A costumed Dave approaches with a can of PAINT and a ROLL He begins to paint a grafitti-covered wall.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Drop a laptop and it’ll break. But when it’s fixed, it’s not gonna be a fuckin’ George Foreman grill.  60 61 62 63 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, in costume, loads SHOPPING BAGS into an SUV for a grateful - if slightly bemused - YOUNG MOM with a BABY.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It is what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave stands beside a DDR DANCING STAGE unit. A huge queue LITTLE KIDS wait their turn while two HULKING TEENAGERS e theirs. Their feet just a blur, you get the feeling they a_lot. One leans forward to put in another handful of coi

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Me? My hardware was fixed now. Dave leans in and stays the boy’s arm, stopping him from inserting the coins. The teens stare at the costumed frea shock. Dave indicates the line of little kids and gives t universal thumb-jerking gesture for get-the-fuck-outta-he Amazingly, the two guys comply, walking away, confused. T crowd of kids CHEER, and the first two in line climb on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's sprint towards the edge of the roof continues.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was back and running Kickass version 2.0. Dave reaches the edge... and stops.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a poster that reads: HAVE YOU SEEN MR. BITEY ??? There’s a PHONE NUMBER and a PHOTO OF A CAT. Pull back to find Dave, in costume, studying it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, maybe I was still in the beta- testing phase. But it was a start.  64 65 66 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave - in costume, remember - walks the neighbourhood, searching for the cat, ignoring the stares of PASSERSBY.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Mr Bitey! Two GANG GIRLS walking past burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A terrified man, OSCAR JUAREZ, 26, runs for his life. In pursuit are three BIG SCARY GUYS. We intercut between this chase, and Dave’s more mundane ambling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the street, Dave spots A CAT eating from the trash outside a FASTFOOD JOINT. This is it. He sprints ac the road towards it, cars honking as he darts between the

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey there Mr. Bitey... C’mon... But the cat makes a break for it, shooting away, up a TRE

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wonderful. Dave climbs the tree as the cat watches disdainfully. In distance, we may see the terrified Oscar Juarez turn onto this street and dash in our direction - but Dave doesn’t. Dave reaches for the cat, but his foot slips and he falls Right onto Oscar, flooring him. Neither can quite believe

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Asshole! Before Dave can speak, he receives a kick in the face. Th three scary guys surround them. The BIGGEST GUY, who just kicked Dave, eyes him as the others haul Oscar to his fee

dialogues.speaker: BIGGEST GUY
dialogues.text: Thanks, freak. The briefest pause. Then he turns and punches Oscar in th mouth. Dave looks on, aghast, as all three lay into Oscar Dave tries to grab the biggest guy, but he shrugs Dave of  67 68 34. BIGGEST GUY (CONT’D) Get the fuck outta here! This ain’t none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, it is. Dave pulls his lead pipe and piles in, blazing, taking hi left, right and centre and landing plenty of his own. A few passerby slow down to gawp. Dave shouts to them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call 911! Somebody call 911! A TEENAGER runs into the nearby fast-food joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teenager bursts in urgently.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Hey! (a beat) There’s a guy dressed like a superhero out there fighting a load of Bloods, it’s fuckin’ awesome! And, as one, the DINERS hurry out into the street to watc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fast-food diners join the large crowd, many now filmi the fight on their cell-phones. Dave gives as good as he gets as he fights to protect Osc The biggest guy, badly beaten, clocks the crowd. Dave’s n going down, and now they’re on camera, too. Time to quit.

dialogues.speaker: BIGGEST GUY
dialogues.text: (to Dave) Fuckin’ freak! He bolts, followed by his cohorts. The crowd bursts into APPLAUSE. Dave leans down to Oscar, hunched on the ground

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You okay, man? It’s chaos here - the crowd shouting, approaching sirens. EXCITED GUY thrusts his cellphone breathlessly towards Da

dialogues.speaker: PHONE GUY
dialogues.text: Woooh! That rocked! Who are you?  69 70 71 35. Dave ignores him and leans in closer to try and hear Osca response. Oscar manages a swollen smile.

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave runs. In the distance, we see the ambulance - now arrived - and much of the crowd still in attendance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave rounds the corner, and after checking nobody's seen he opens the dumpster and retrieves a PLASTIC SHOPPING BA He empties it out - it’s his CLOTHES. He pulls off his ma He’s bleeding and bruised but can’t help grinning. He did INT. DAVE’S ROOM. DAY. 71 Dave peers at his bruised face in a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: This look like it’s going down any? Todd, at Dave’s desk browsing YOUTUBE, doesn’t move. Mart on the floor playing BIOSHOCK on the Xbox, looks up brief

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Give it time man. Only been a week.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Hey, did you see “Pretty Fly for a Draenei”?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah. Todd looks slightly crushed. Then his face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: TODD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah wait, did you see that thing with the superhero guy? From round here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What thing? Surely it can’t be...? Dave tosses aside his CONTROLLER a moves over to the computer. Marty follows.  72 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the low-ish res of a youtube clip, we see Dave, bent o Oscar. The camera thrusts towards him.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE GUY, (OS)
dialogues.text: Woooh! That rocked! Who are you? Dave leans down to hear Oscar. Then looks up into the cam

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I’m Kickass. MUSIC kicks in now as we follow the explosion of Dave’s f - A Youtube page, showing the fight. It’s titled: Kickass Real life Superhero. Underneath it says: VIEWS: 10,019 - Footage from a LOCAL NEWS CHANNEL. A FEMALE ANCHOR spea

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: And coming up after the hour: a costumed vigilante has become the latest internet phenomenon after a Hamilton Park resident filmed the man’s remarkable intervention in a gang-related attack last week... - More Youtube footage. Now the counter says: VIEWS: 208, - In the school corridor, the mathlete and gamer kids we earlier stand together by their lockers, talking excitedl

dialogues.speaker: MATHLETE
dialogues.text: (impersonating the clip) My name is Kickass!

dialogues.speaker: GAMER
dialogues.text: No, no, no, he just goes, like, “I'm kickass”. Then he runs off. - In the studios of THE TODAY SHOW, Oscar sits nervously, being interviewed by MEREDITH VIERA.

dialogues.speaker: MEREDITH VIERA
dialogues.text: And what would you say to him, if you did, do you think?

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: If I saw him again? I guess, just how brave he was. And, y’know, just... thank you. - Dave at his computer, on his Kickass MYSPACE page. - Another Youtube clip. Now it says: VIEWS: 5,630,621.  73 74 37. - Katie, in pyjamas, lies on her bed with her friend Erik painting her nails and watching THE SOUP. On TV we see:

dialogues.speaker: JOEL MCHALE
dialogues.text: And now it’s time for our kickass clip of the week... Someone dressed as KICKASS runs in, brandishing a stick. JOEL MCHALE (CONT’D) Not you, Kickass. You were our clip of the week last week. (shouting offscreen) I think we’re gonna have to change that segment title.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letterman is reading out the top ten list.

dialogues.speaker: LETTERMAN
dialogues.text: Top ten signs your neighbor is kickass, number nine: Answers phone, "Kickass residence -- I mean, Smith residence". Laughter from the audience, the usual drum roll continues LETTERMAN (CONT’D) Number eight: The family of supervillains across the street have really been on edge lately. INT. DAMON AND MINDY’S PLACE. NIGHT. 74 Mindy reads a COMIC while Damon performs pull-ups in the frame and watches LATE NIGHT WITH DAVID LETTERMAN.

dialogues.speaker: LETTERMAN
dialogues.text: (on TV) .+.-your neighbor is Kickass, number seven: Lists his likes as country music, softball and leaping tall buildings in a single bound.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I like kickass. Damon, still performing pull ups, doesn’t respond.

dialogues.speaker: LETTERMAN
dialogues.text: (on TV) Number six: claims he's getting 50 miles to the gallon since switching to hybrid Kickass-mobile.  38.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Did you see the clip? He was pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Good at getting his ass kicked. He shoulda called himself asskick instead.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: That doesn’t even make sense. 75 INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE. NIGHT. 75 Frank, Angie and Chris are also watching Letterman.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID LETTERMAN
dialogues.text: (on TV) Number four: A lot of "thanks for hospitalizing my attackers" bouquets being delivered.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The kid’s gonna end up dead, is what I think.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID LETTERMAN
dialogues.text: (on TV) Number three. His last house-guest: The Silver Surfer.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: No way. He owns. I’d mail his site if I had a problem needed fixing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? Tell me you’re fucking kidding me! I got a hundred guys could fix a problem and you'd call some Jersey City doofus?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID LETTERMAN
dialogues.text: (on TV) Number two: Mailman mistakenly puts "cowl-of-the-month club" catalog in your box.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Well I wouldn’t wanna get in the way of your “business”. Where I’m not wanted. 76 INT. DAVE’S HOUSE. NIGHT. 76 Dave watches TV with his dad.  39.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID LETTERMAN
dialogues.text: (on TV) And the number one sign that your neighbor is Kick Ass: You hear his television blaring "Extreme makeover - Internet Superhero edition". On TV, the audience applaud.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: Is that the guy from round here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Uh... That kickass guy? I guess so. Had you... seen that clip before?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: I heard about it. The guys at work were... I had a fight with one of ‘em about it, actually. Said to him: when your son’s been mugged half a dozen times, then you come tell me what you think of vigilantes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: He’s more, like, a superhero. Than a vigilante. Wouldn’t you say?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: Meh. The costume I could do without. Hey, this reminds me, did you look at that catalogue I gave you? The personal tasers?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I said fine. I’1ll carry one if you want me to.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: You were gonna pick a color.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I don’t know, they were all kind of gay. I think they’re, like, meant for girls or something.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? They had, like, camo, and purple...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Exactly!  77 78 40.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: Camo is gay now? You wanna tell the armed forces or shall I?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No, look, fine, I’1l have Camo. Camo is fine. But I’m... You don’t have to worry about me, Dad... I wish you wouldn’t worry about me. INT. DAVE’S ROOM. NIGHT. 77 Dave sits down at his computer and logs onto Myspace.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My MySpace: 38 friends. Kickass’s MySpace: 16k and counting. He scrolls through his mail. We catch flashes of text: “C you help?” ... “and I swear I know for sure he did it” .. “3rd armed hold-up in two months” ... “broke into my car” Dave begins to type a reply: “I’m working my way through backlog of requests right now, but I’1l get to yours as s as I can. Yours sincerely...” He erases “sincerely” and types “truly”. Erases that, typ “keep it real”. Then wipes that too and just types “Kicka

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave strides to his locker, his face still bruised from Kickass’s now-legendary fight, but more confident than ev Katie, approaching from the other direction, smiles at hi

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Hey. Wary this time, Dave looks over his shoulder. Katie laugh

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dave. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (surprised) Oh... Hey.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: How’s the... Uh... She gestures to her face. He pats his own bruised face.  41.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Ah, good, thanks, yeah. Much better. Not as bad as last time, that’s for sure!

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Hey, you’re into comicbooks, aren't ou? (off his wary nod) Well... me and Erika sometimes hang after school at this great store, Gotham Comics? They have a Starbucks. Actually, I always see those two friends of yours there?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah...?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I mean... I could buy you a coffee there sometime if you want? If you, like, need someone to talk to?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Um... Sure. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Cool. What, today? Tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Um... Today... sure, why not? Today’s good.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Sweet! See ya later, then! And she’s off. Dave spots Todd and Marty lurking nearby a walks over, in a euphoric daze.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Man, did you just see that?! Todd and Marty exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Don’t wanna piss on your fries, dude, but it might not be... what you think.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Yeah, because, Katie Deauxma, she’s, like, the world’s biggest carebear?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  42.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Just look at her friends: Erika Cho - self harmer. Kanesha whats-her- name - alopecia. And I heard Ariel Kressly’s piano tutor interfered with her.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Really? What, like, actual rape, or he just felt her up and stuff?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: The point is, Katie Deauxma is all about the lame ducks.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What’s that got to do with me? Dave and Marty exchange another look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave walks to the store with Todd and Marty. He is mid-ra

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: But... A rent boy?! A fucking rent boy?? What kind of rumor is that?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Well you know, getting mugged...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You guys have been mugged!

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you got beat up, and you had, like, no clothes on that time?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: That’s not even true! The medic threw my clothes away!

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: And, like, someone said when you went through the metal detector the other day they saw you turn in this really gay-looking personal taser?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: It’s camo!

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Aw, forget about it man. Rumors don’t mean shit. The people who care about you know the truth.  43.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Yeah. And who knows, it might even get you laid. They've arrived at the comic store.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Not if she thinks he’s gay, Todd, you fucktard!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, Marty. Dave opens the door and we see his stunned reaction to: ...the store as he’s never seen it before. It’s rammed, a the demographic has expanded wildly to include a lot of g and a good cross section of teenage society. At the coffe shop, a sign says: “TODAY'S SPECIAL: KICKASS CAPPUCCINO”

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit, what happened? Marty flicks a huge promotional cardboard sign: the cover Kickass number 1. A strap-line on it says: COMING SOON.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: This guy happened. Dave gapes at the poster. But before he can comment, he h his name being called and spots Katie, in the coffee- sho waving. Todd and Marty shoo him over to her. Moments later, we find Dave sitting at a table and Katie returning to him, carrying two frappucinos. She sits down

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You really didn’t have to get mine.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: It’s my pleasure. You’ve had kind of a rough time. I think the least I can do is buy you a coffee.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah... about that, I -

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: God, I’m sorry - I didn’t wanna... you don’t have to talk about it. But if you ever want to... I’m, you know. A good listener.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Right... Thanks. So... (reaching for a subject) Do you actually... Read comics?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Well, I only just started, but yeah. The guy recommended some. Let’s see... Love and Rockets. Dan Clowes. That kinda thing. I’m not so big on all the superhero stuff.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Guess you won't be lining up for that Kickass comic, then.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Guess not. But you know what, I was seriously thinking of mailing that guy's site? I could use some help from a guy like that right now.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Help? Really? What with?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Oh, boyfriend troubles. But the last thing you need is me unloading. I mean, everything you've been through? My stupid problems are, like, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (trying to hide despair) Don't be dumb... I mean, I’m fine. I'm... But... (lightening the mood) Kickass? Those must be some pretty serious boyfriend troubles! He cracks up at his joke ‘til he realizes she’s not kiddi

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: You can’t even imagine. (a beat) So... What comic books do you like?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You can tell me, if you want. I mean... I’m a guy. I could maybe... Give you a guy’s perspective or something?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: (a beat) Okay... You know I volunteer at the needle exchange?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Uh... No, I didn’t.  80 81 45.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Well, there was this one guy, Rasul? The more I found out about his upbringing and stuff? I just felt so sorry for him, and... Wow, this is weird, unloading. I’m usually the one playing therapist.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Well, I’m... here for you, and all that kinda thing. Katie reaches across the table and squeezes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Can I make a confession? Ever since I was young I always wanted a... a friend who was... A friend like you? I hope it’s okay to say that? It’s not homophobic, is it? I don’t, like, think you're all the same or something, I mean - Dave takes her hand in his. May as well get what he can g

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Shhh. Of course not. Carry on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave - in costume - walks the street. A few KIDS cheer as passes. Some NO-GOOD TYPES cross the street nervously. A SHADY-LOOKING GUY unexpectedly high-fives him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don’t know if I was everything Katie had always dreamed her gay b.f£.£. would be. But I tried my best. And, more importantly, I talked her into mailing Kickass. At a nasty block, he pushes bells ‘til someone buzzes him

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Long story short, this particular lame duck of hers had turned out to be more of a lame cobra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave climbs a filthy stairwell, walks a dilapidated corri  82

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She didn’t want the money back that she'd given him, or an apology for the black eye he’d given her. She just wanted him to get that they were through, and leave her alone. (a beat) And - let’s be real - no other request could’ve given me more pleasure. Dave stops outside one of the doors and pushes the bell. door is opened by LEROY, 21, huge and intimidating.

dialogues.speaker: LEROY
dialogues.text: Ain't Halloween for another few months, kid.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Are you Rasul?

dialogues.speaker: LEROY
dialogues.text: No... Who’s that under there? Dave steps in, shouldering his way past the puzzled Leroy INT. RASUL’S APARTMENT. NIGHT. A depressing drug den in which RASUL - 19, cute but waste sits playing CALL OF DUTY 4 with some other THUG. Dave walks in, followed by LEROY.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Which one of you guys is Rasul?

dialogues.speaker: RASUL
dialogues.text: Who's that? Leroy, who is this? Leroy shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: The fuck is this, trick or treat?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You don’t know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: RASUL
dialogues.text: No!? (re: the game) Great, now I’m dead. Rasul tosses his controller aside, bemused and angry.  47.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I, I have a message for Rasul. About Katie Deauxma. (off his reaction) You’re Rasul? Ok. You’ve gotta stay away from Katie now. It’s over. And, uh... You just need to... leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: RASUL
dialogues.text: What? Who are you? What is this?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I’m Kickass. Look me up. And this is me giving you a message: leave Katie alone.

dialogues.speaker: RASUL
dialogues.text: (standing up menacingly) Or what?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I’1l come back and break your fucking legs. Dave turns to leave, but Leroy steps into his path. Rasul grabs Dave’s shoulder, but before he can do anythin else, Dave has pulled his TASER. He tasers Rasul, who shr and falls twitching to the ground. Dave tries to make a break for it, but Leroy tackles him the ground. Dave struggles to load his spare cartridge in the now empty taser, but Leroy is too strong. The other thug helps Rasul up, and Rasul pulls a knife.

dialogues.speaker: RASUL
dialogues.text: You are so fucking dead, man! I’m —- He stops in mid sentence and his eyes bug out as he looks down in surprise at: a LONG BLADE bursting from his stoma He keels over forwards to reveal a huge knife through his back and, standing behind him, the tiny costumed figure w put it there. Her mask conceals her face, but when she pu a pair of butterfly knives from her little utility belt a begins to flip them, we know for sure that it’s Mindy.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Who’s next? Leroy and the thug look at one another in disbelief, and stands frozen in shock as Mindy launches herself at them.  83 84 48. It’s an extraordinary sight as this tiny, lethal figure f between the two, knives flashing, deflecting every blow a she slices and dices these two guys three times her size. When they lie bleeding, she pulls the knife from Rasul’s and stares at Dave. Terrified, he aims his taser at her.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dude, that is one fuckin’ gay- lookin’ taser. (a beat) Chill. We’re on the same team. Dave lowers it, dumbstruck, and watches as she turns the apartment upside down. Soon, she finds a holdall and pull out several BAGS OF COCAINE. She crams them back in the holdall, grabs it and heads for an OPEN WINDOW - the way came in, we presume. She climbs out onto the fire escape. Dave watches her, still glued to the spot. Mindy pokes he head back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C’mon, dipshit. Can’t use the front door now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too scared to protest, Dave follows her up the fire escap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave stops, out of breath. Reluctantly, Mindy pauses too.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Wait, wait... Who are you? She holds out her little gloved hand. It’s covered in oth people’s blood. Reluctantly, Dave shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I’m Hitgirl. And that’s Big Daddy. She points to the next building where we can see Damon, a in superhero costume. Dave gives him a small, awkward wav Damon salutes, puts his fingers to his lips - shhh - then draws his finger across his throat.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. She breaks into a run towards the edge of the roof.  85 86 87 49. Dave runs too but, as the gap between the buildings yawns wide before him, slams on the brakes in terror at the las moment. Mindy keeps going, leaping fearlessly into the vo and landing on the roof opposite. She looks back, shrugs, takes Damon’s hand and waves good to Dave before the two turn and run towards the next roof And they’re gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave climbs shakily down the fire escape to the street.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hitgirl and Big Daddy, they were the real deal. Me, I was just a stupid dick in a wetsuit. INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 86 Dave sneaks into his room and sits down heavily on the be

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A stupid dick with a real problem. The superhero duvet-cover, toys and other detritus of Dav childhood around the room remind us that he’s just a kid. pulls off his blood-spattered mask, curls up into a ball starts to cry. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - KITCHEN. DAY. 87 A grim-faced Big Joe sits with Frank, the huge goon nearb

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight: 8 of my guys are dead, and we have no merchandise on the street at all.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: No, 8 last night. 15 altogether. And six more missing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay. I want everyone on this. The Russians want a war? Then a fucking war is what they’re gonna get.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Frankie... I don’t think it’s the Russians. Take a look at this: He holds his hand out and the goon passes him a blood-sta cellphone. He wipes it with his sleeve and gives it to Fr  88 50. BIG JOE (CONT’D) Sal's phone. It was in his hand. ON THE PHONE’S SCREEN: A blurred image of a large costume figure - who we might recognise as Big Daddy - vaulting o of an open window. BIG JOE (CONT’D) I know this sounds fucked up? But we think it’s that guy. That superhero guy from the TV.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Kickass? One guy?? If you’re right, we're gonna look like the biggest bunch of pussies in New York! Man... Go ahead and look into it.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Look into it, yeah. Okay. Just to double check... You want -

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: KICKASS’S FUCKING HEAD ON A STICK! And I want it YESTERDAY! INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 88 Dave lies in bed, asleep, and gradually we realize that i this is a POV shot: somebody is creeping closer as he doz Dave's eyes snap open and he leaps out of bed, cowering. Mindy and Damon in full Hit Girl and Big Daddy costume.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I didn’t say anything, to anyone, I swear!

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Good move. Let’s keep it that way. Dave nods like crazy. Petrified. Mindy holds out a handfu unfamiliar-looking SMALL PLASTIC BITS. Dave peers at them

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Know what this is? All the cartridge shit that comes outta your gay taser when you fire it. You do know the police could’a traced it right back to you if they'd found it? Lucky for you, I picked it up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I, I... Thanks.  51. Dave reaches out to take the pieces from her. Damon’s han shoots out and grabs Dave’s wrist before it gets anywhere near. With his other hand, he takes the pieces himself.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Let’s call it insurance. Makes it easier for me to take your word. See, we like you. But we don’t trust you.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Don’t take it personal though. We don’t trust anybody.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I recommend it. (a beat) Listen, I re-routed your IP address for you. Finding you was way too easy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Shit... I hadn’t - God, I owe you. But, you know, I’m thinking of shutting my site down anyway, quitting. This is... insane. I’m in way over my head.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Shame. You have potential.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Your call. But, y’know, we’re around if you need us.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (humouring him) Thanks. That’s really nice of you.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: We don’t do nice. But put it this way, there’s a whole lot of people in this town we'd rather see accessorizing with a toe tag.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: How do I get hold of you?

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: (deadpan ) Oh just contact the mayor's office. He has this special signal he shines into the sky? It’s in the shape of a dick and balls.  52.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You need us, put on your site that you're on vacation. We’ll find you. Dave nods, confused. Damon salutes, takes Mindy by the ha and climbs out of the window. Mindy follows, blowing a ki

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sits on a pink sofa by a curtained changing cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Murder. Superheroes breaking into my bedroom. And now Katie Deauxma undressing three feet away from me. Nothing seemed real any more.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (from behind the curtain) So, I didn’t get a mail back from Kickass, but it’s been a whole week since I’ve heard from Rasul? She emerges from behind the curtain in an absurdly sexy dress. She does a little twirl in front of the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: ..-Awesome. Just... Wow.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Shit, can you totally see my nipples?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Uh... No. A bit? Is that bad? She throws a few poses in the mirror, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Being Katie’s gay best friend sucked and rocked in equal measure. Somehow, I mostly managed not to get a boner... Katie sticks her hand into her top, assessing the transparency of the fabric.  90 91 53.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Oh hey, I read those old Ditko Spidermans you gave me? They were actually pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...But there’s only so much control aman can have in the presence of perfection. He grabs a cushion from beside him and places it on his l INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - STUDY. DAY. 90 Frank is on the phone, with Big Joe at his side.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I need you to get rid of Kickass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his office, DETECTIVE VIC GIGANTE, 50s, cradles the ph in his sweaty neck as he chows down on Chinese takeout. We now intercut between the two men.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
