dialogues.text: Kickass is killing my men, that’s what’s up, Gigante.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: My condolences. No can do, though. Outside my remit.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Outside your remit?? You’re a fucking cop and he’s breaking the law! That’s so inside your remit it’s ball-deep in your remit’s ass!

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: Listen: The cops pay me to nail the bad guys. You pay me not to. Everything else is a grey area. There’s no evidence on Kickass, and trust me, folks here ain’t ina hurry to find any. He’s just doing what a lot of ‘em would like to do.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Fuck you very much, Vic. Just do it, okay?  92 93 54.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: Frankie - Frank picks up a framed photo on his desk. We can’t see i

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Boy, you sure look good in that picture I have of you down in Tijuana last year. Maybe I should put it on Facebook. You think? Frank slams the phone down, checks the time and turns to

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where the hell is Dimitri?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon and Mindy, in Big Daddy and Hit Girl costume, are upside down. It soon becomes apparent that this is the PO DIMITRI, 30. He’s strapped into a seat in an upside down

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Thank you, Dimitri. We appreciate your cooperation.

dialogues.speaker: DIMITRI
dialogues.text: Let me out now. Let me down. (off their silence) I gave you all them names and address. (more silence) I won’t say nothing to nobody. We pull back to see that the car is inside a CRUSHER. Min smiles and hits a BUTTON. The crusher grinds into action. Momentarily, a small metal CUBE lands at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: What a fucking douche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gigante has called a group of COPS into his office. All s around, staring into space, largely disinterested, except Detective Marcus Williams. The cop we saw tailing Mindy.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: Look, I get that you all like him. I’m just saying we give hima friendly reminder that we don’t encourage the public to take the law into their own hands.  94 95 55.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: This is not about us liking him, Gigante. It’s about having better things to do than hunt down some guy who roughed up a few gang- bangers.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: Ah. Detective Williams. Why am I not surprised by your lack of co- operation?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’ll keep an eye out. But trust me, we have bigger burgers to barbecue.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: Then you better get your damn apron on, Marcus. Dismissed. All of you. INT. DAMON AND MINDY’S PLACE. DAY. 94 There’s nobody here. Suddenly, the LOCK on the door flies and onto the floor. Detective Marcus walks in. He inspects the apartment, stopping at the wall. Where be we saw the row of comic-book style portraits is now a hug pyramid arrangement of pictures. The lower ones - all the gangsters Damon and Mindy have killed, including Rasul - red crosses through them. The higher ones are as-yet unmarked. At the very top is Frank. Marcus keeps walking, notes the huge stash of weapons. He opens drawers and rifles through their contents. He picks what appears to be a home-made COMIC, and begins to read.

dialogues.speaker: ANIMATED COMIC BOOK SEQUENCE. 95
dialogues.text: - We linger on the first panel, static. Two cops - a blac guy and a white guy bearing more than a passing resemblan to Damon and Marcus himself - stand side-by-side, beaming proudly. In front of them, a photographer snaps a shot. - In the next panel, also static, we see the shot, captur in black and white on the cover of a newspaper. The headl above it reads: LOCAL SUPER-COP TEAM LEAD THE WAR ON DRUG - We whip to the third panel, still static, to see the wh cop - definitely Damon - about to get into his cop car wh hand taps him on the shoulder. - Now the artwork comes to life in animation as we see Da turn around to see a man who is unmistakably Frank. He ha oleaginous smile and a huge fistful of money.  56. - A thought-bubble springs from Damon’s head, containing image of himself and a pretty, heavily-pregnant woman, standing together in front of a dingy apartment block. Th image magically changes to show the two wearing new, upsc clothes, standing outside a beautiful mansion. - The thought bubble bursts, and we pan back down to Damo shaking his head and holding up his hand to refuse the mo - Frank, red-faced, hands in angry fists, smoke coming fr his head. Suddenly a light-bulb appears overhead. He grin - Damon and his pregnant wife watch TV. Suddenly, a huge of cops burst in! The cops tear through the apartment unt one - whom we recognise as Gigante - produces two huge ba of white powder. Damon and his wife react in shock. - An establishing image of jail house gates. - In a prison cell, Damon sits, his head in his hands. - Outside the jail, a sad Marcus puts a comforting arm ar Damon's now-even-more-heavily-pregnant wife, who is cryin - In his penthouse, Frank laughs maniacally. - In a female hand, we see an envelope marked “bill”. It tossed into the air and we follow it as it lands atop a colossal tower of other bills. We pan down to find Damon' pregnant wife sitting in its shadow, weeping. - Marcus enters Damon’s place, looking concerned. His loo turns to horror as he sees: Damon’s wife lying on the gro a bottle of pills in her hand, pills scattered about. - An ambulance streaks across the frame, siren blaring. - A doctor lifts a newborn baby into view... But we pan d to see another doctor, mournfully drawing a sheet over th peaceful face of Damon's wife. She’s dead. - The first doctor hands the smiling baby to Marcus. - Marcus and the baby - now in a little pink dress, a bow her hair - sit in a prison visiting room, the baby waving a sad-faced Damon. - In a sunny playground, Marcus plays happily with the ba now a pretty little toddler, becoming recognizably Mindy. - In the jail, Damon works out aggressively, transforming from a regular guy into the Big Daddy we now know, acquir a moustache and a psychotic look in his eye along the way - A comic book caption says: FOUR YEARS LATER... Outside jail-house gates, Marcus hands Mindy - now looking about years old - over to Damon, and she waves goodbye to Marcu  96 57. - The sky darkens. All around them we see the squalor of run-down, crime-ridden neighbourhood. And looming over th filling the horizon, is the giant demonic face of Frank. - Close on Damon's big hand. Mindy puts her little hand i his. Pull back to see they are now in costume: Hit Girl a Big Daddy. Ready to fight back. The image freezes and we back again to see... INT. DAMON AND MINDY’S PLACE. DAY. 96 .-+.-The comic book in Marcus’s hand. He jumps as he hear

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: How did you find me?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: One of us is still a cop, remember?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: So go ahead, Marcus. Arrest me. Marcus gestures at the comic and the wall of portraits.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: This how you brainwashed Mindy?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You say brainwashed. I say made it into a game.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: This your idea of playing, Damon? Vigilante justice? Mass murder? (a beat) Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I sent her onto the roof when I saw someone had busted the lock.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I want to see her. I... I miss her, Damon. I miss you both.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I appreciate your concern. But you need to go now. Marcus looks down to see: Damon has a gun levelled at him Marcus shakes his head sadly.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Please, hear me out first: that asshole Gigante is looking for Kickass. I needed to warn you.  58.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Kickass?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah. He anything to do with you? You got some kinda fucked-up superhero club going or something?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Hardly know the guy.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Well, I wanted to give you a heads up. You carry on like you've been doing and it’s only a matter of time before Gigante’s looking for you, too. He’s been on D’Amico’s payroll ever since you passed up the opportunity, no doubt about it.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You got proof?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Working on it. But nevermind that. Point is, you screw with D’Amico, the cops are gonna be all over you.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You know I’m not gonna stop. Not ‘til D’Amico and his whole damn operation are toast.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Ain’t gonna bring her back, Damon.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Damon's gone, Marcus. Damon died when she died. I’m Big Daddy now.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: This is no life for Mindy, know. You owe that kid a thi tdhood.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: No, I‘’ll tell you who owes her a childhood: Frank D’Amico. Now get the hell out of here. 97 INT. D’AMICO’S LIMO. DAY. 97 Frank, fuming over his situation, sits tensely in the bac seat beside the Huge Goon. Suddenly, he spots something.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Holy shit... Stop!  98 59. The driver complies, and now we see what Frank has: Kicka Just walking. The goon pulls his gun. Frank stays his han

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the driver) Follow that superhero. (to the heavens) Thank you. The limo crawls along a discreet distance behind Kickass he continues on his way, oblivious, pausing only for the occasional high-five from passers by. He takes a left dow quiet side-street.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, you are mine. As the limo corners, Frank leaps out and runs at Kickass.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Kickass! Kickass spins round to be met with a perfect round-house from Frank. He goes down instantly. Frank, utterly out of control, kicks him furiously as he lies there, motionless

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kill my men, huh?! Take my fucking coke?! A lone ONLOOKER stops and stares in horror at the bizarre sight of a well-dressed man laying into a superhero.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to onlooker) You want some?! The onlooker runs away, as the goon runs over, gun in han

dialogues.speaker: HUGE GOON
dialogues.text: Boss, what the fuck?! Frank snatches it and shoots the fleeing onlooker before holding the gun to Kickass’s head and pulling the trigger INT. KATIE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 98 Katie is on her bed sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: ...-I just can’t believe he’s dead, that’s all. We pull back to find Dave. Alive, well and comforting Kat He puts his arm gingerly around her shoulder.  99 60.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I know. But, Katie, guys like Rasul... They get mixed up in stuff, and...

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I know, but what if it was my fault? What if Kickass did it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Oh my god, you’re talking crazy! Katie, there’s no way! He probably didn’t even read your mail yet. Katie throws her arms round Dave and hugs him, sobbing in his neck. He holds her, guiltily relishing the opportunit

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C’mon. Don’t cry. Let’s go out and buy you... some candy? And some of those magazines you like where they draw the red circle on the picture if a celebrity has, like, an extra long toe or something. She nods and wipes her nose, looking fondly into his eyes

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: You're the best, Dave. I hope it’s okay to say this but... It so sucks that you’re gay. Dave opens his mouth to speak... but changes his mind. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - KITCHEN. DAY. 99 Frank holds a NEWSPAPER up to Big Joe and flicks it angri

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What kind of fucking children’s entertainer is that? What kind of kid has... I mean, a Spiderman party, sure, but... a fucking Kickass party!? What, are they doing paper plates and fucking napkins at the store now? Unnoticed by Frank and Joe, Chris walks in behind them an puts a Pop-tart in the toaster.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Frank, you're scaring me. You're losing it. Since when did you start getting your hands dirty again? And in public!?  61.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Since when I ask you fucks to get me Kickass, and you don’t deliver, that’s when.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Gimme a break, it’s been a week! We mailed him, we got half our guys out doing petty crimes as bait, we're busting our asses, here. Frank produces a wrap of COKE and empties it onto the tab He begins to chop out a line. BIG JOE (CONT’D) The hell are you doing? You're back on the powder now as well? Frank ignores him and hoovers it up, muttering to himself

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: “Mommy, I wanna Kickass party”. Dumb little fucks.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I know a way you could get him. Frank and Joe swivel round, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Chris! Who said you could come in?! Get the hell out!

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You wanna hear it or not? Reluctantly, Frank nods - go on. Chris tries not to betra his thrill at finally being accepted into his dad's world

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, look: you’re a superhero. It’s lonely. But who do you trust? You can’t really trust anyone, right? Because either they’ll find out your secret identity, or -

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to Joe, interrupting) Comic books, this kids reads, all fucking day long.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Point is, there’s only one way a superhero would trust a stranger. And... I could be that stranger. Just... Give me a chance. I can do it. I just need a few things.  62.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I need these things. Chris hands Frank a handwritten list. He scans it.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What are you fucking kidding me? A Shelby Mustang? A... What is this?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: It’s all the stuff I’1l need. And you have to fuck somebody over. Like, Louie, or somebody.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Louie?! Woah woah woah, Chris -— Frank holds his hand up to Joe, motions for Chris to go o

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Or somebody. But I swear, dad. If you let me do this, it’1l work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, Todd and Marty drink their coffees in the busy stor

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: So how are things going with Katie?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Oh, just peachy. Spent the weekend watching the entire Ugly Betty box set and doing pedicures.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I’m telling you, man: longer you leave it, the worse it’s gonna be.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I know, I know. I’m gonna tell her. She just seems so... happy. It never feels like the right time.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Well, now’s your chance. Marty nods to the door: Katie’s just walked in. She runs over, plonks herself on Dave’s lap, kisses him on the che

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Hey guys.  101 63. The boys mumble their greetings.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god, did you see on TV this morning? The new superhero guy? How cool was that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What? Who? Katie pulls out her IPHONE, but then spots the store’s TV which is running the news with the sound muted. She squea excitedly and waves to the BARISTA.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Oooh, can you please turn it up? (to the boys) Check this! The Barista shrugs and complies, and everyone in the stor turns to watch the screen. On it we see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An indignant, HANDCUFFED MAN is pushed into a police van. Nearby, other COPS swarm industriously. A superhero in an awesome red costume signs autographs for a gathering crow This is RED MIST. (Who is - as we’ll surely guess - Chris

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..-After the death last week of a local children’s entertainer who was dressed as Kickass. But it seems that far from being put-off, this individual, who calls himself Red Mist, decided to take crime fighting to a new level, as his actions last night proved. Cut Red Mist, still signing autographs for a clamoring cr as he talks to the news reporter.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I guess folks have had enough of living with fear, and uh... Kickass proved that one person can make a difference. If anyone needs help, I’m gonna be fighting crime twenty-— five/eight. And I’m just a click away. (he stares down the lense) Red Mist dot com. Cut to a shot of some SUSHI being picked up with CHOPSTIC  102 103 64.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Up next... A deadly threat at your dinner table? Why eating sushi could kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barista turns the sound down again, and the store bre into excited chatter. Some kids use their cells to log on Red Mist’s site. In the background we may notice Chris himself. Here and Loving it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What did he do?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: He got, like, some drug dealer? Some most-wanted guy? You saw ‘em bringing out, like, a ton of stuff, the cops were wetting their pants.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Better costume than Kickass.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Aw, they're both kinda hot. But he has a better body than Kickass. Don’t you think, Dave?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: (trying not to laugh) Yeah, whaddya think Dave? He the kinda guy you’d go for? Before Dave can comment, they are all distracted by a sho across the room: the mathlete kid is making the “rock on! corna double hand-gesture to his friends.

dialogues.speaker: MATHLETE
dialogues.text: (celebratory rock growl) Red Miiiiist! He looks down and adjusts his glasses, embarrassed, when realizes that everyone is looking at him. INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 103 Dave is at his desk, fuming. On the monitor: RED MIST’S S It’s fabulous. A ticker says- VISITORS: 5,688,502. Dave drains a CAN OF SODA and throws it, far harder than necessary, into the wastepaper basket under his desk.  104 65.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Apparently Katie wasn’t the only one who thought Red Mist owned. He punches a few keys and the KICKASS WEBSITE comes up. A button says - NEW MAIL: 2. Dave clicks on it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seemed like hardly anybody wanted to talk to Kickass any more. Dave opens a mail. It’s an advert for a PENIS ENLARGER. He opens the second... and leans in, surprised and intrig We see a snatch of the mail: ...JUST TELL ME A TIME AND PLACE, IT’D BE COOL TO HOOK UP. YOURS, RED MIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave, in his Kickass costume, enters the alleyway cautiou

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Kickass. Dave looks up to the source of the voice to see Chris, in Red Mist costume, standing iconically on a high wall.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Red Mist. Chris jumps down in front of Dave.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Owww. Shit. That was higher than it looked.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (clearly in pain) Yep. Chris collects himself and shakes Dave’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you're really here. You’re my hero, man. You... inspired me. I mean, no Kickass? No Red Mist. Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Wow, I... Really?  105 66.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Straight up. And, look, if you ever wanted me to be, I don’t know, your sidekick...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You wanna be... my sidekick??

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean, you and me? Together? Would we own or what? I mean, wanna go fight some crime or something?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What, now?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Why not? C’mon, I got a thing I wanna show you. Dave follows him, protesting.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: To be honest with you? I really only fight crime between, like, nine and two weekdays, so I’m gonna need to get back pretty soon... They turn the corner to see: a gorgeous MUSTANG.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sweet!! Is that yours?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Meet the Mistmobile. Check it out: He opens the passenger door and Dave gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris points to various things in the car.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Sat-nav. My iphone - so I can check the website for emergencies while I’m driving around. Uh... Cup holder... Dave notices a pile of COMICS scattered in the foot well. Chris produces what appears to be a JOINT.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry about the mess. Smoke? (off Dave’s head shake) I find a lil’ zoot takes the edge off when I’m on patrol. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Going up against a crowd... it can get pretty scary, don’t you find? (off Dave’s silence) Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You’re so not how I expected? Chris shrugs, sparks up and starts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Seatbelt? Dave buckles up, still bemused. Chris hits play on the stereo. Danny Elfman MUSIC kicks in. Chris floors the ped

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. THE MISTMOBILE. CONTINUOUS. 106
dialogues.text: They speed down the street. Excited PASSERSBY stop and wa Chris grabs his i-phone, hits a key and puts it down agai

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: So, I got a mail from this chick, said some guy keeps following her home from work. I have the address and stuff. You wanna check it out?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Sure, why not? They throw a sharp, screeching left into a dodgy street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten Goons, armed to the teeth. Huge Goon talks into his c

dialogues.speaker: HUGE GOON
dialogues.text: Just got an SMS. He’s on his way. INT. D’AMICO’S LIMO. NIGHT. 108 Frank's in the back on his cell, beside Joe.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don’t kill him ‘til I get there. He hangs up and pockets the phone.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Looks like reading all them comics paid off, huh? Your boy did good.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He’s his father’s son.  109 112 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The superheroes drive to the suitably heroic music, the s undermined only slightly by the interruption of the Sat-N

dialogues.speaker: SAT-NAV LADY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In 100 yards, turn left. INT. D’AMICO’S LIMO. NIGHT 110 Frank grins to himself as he loads his GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our superheroes screech round a corner.

dialogues.speaker: SAT-NAV LADY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Destination. Destination. Chris stops the car and the two stare out ahead, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: What... the... fuck????

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back from the car to see: The warehouse. It’s on fir The boys swing the doors open, climb out and stare some m

dialogues.speaker: SAT-NAV LADY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Destination. Destination.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Oh my god. Chris begins to run towards the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: There are people in there!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we just call... Oh shit. Okay. No choice. Dave runs after him.  113 114 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our superheroes cough and splutter through the smoke. Wit moments, Chris has sprinted away, losing Dave. Dave enters the main open space, in which he eventually s the Huge Goon, lying on the floor, face down, out cold. Dave hoists the man’s arm over his shoulder and, with gre difficulty, begins to drag him towards the exit. As the g begins to slip, Dave gives a little tug on his arm. The m head tips back to reveal his face: his eyes are rolled ba in his head and his mouth has been cut nearly all the way the ear on both sides. Dave screams, drops him and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he continues his nightmarish fight through the flames, Dave now spots one heap of CORPSES after another: Frank’s henchmen. Some shot, other displaying extensive knife wou Utterly freaked out, Dave reaches a door... but it’s jamm

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Red Mist! Red Mist! Overcome by the smoke, Dave slumps to the ground. Suddenly out of the miasma comes: a gloved hand. Chris pu Dave up and they run, finally reaching the doorway to saf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Chris emerge from the flames, looking every inch authentic superheroes, bar the fact that they haven’t res anyone and Chris appears to be holding A BURNT TEDDY BEAR A group of BYSTANDERS have gathered. They applaud.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE CHRIS
dialogues.text: Holy shit, that was... Oh my god. Oh my god. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Did you see all those bodies? Chris nods in horror. In the distance, SIRENS.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: We've gotta get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (noticing the teddy) Why’d you save the teddy...?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: What? I don’t know. Come on. And they jump into the still-open Mistmobile and drive of  70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank climbs from his limo and gapes in disbelief at the sight greeting him: the warehouse on fire. In the distanc SIRENS. Frank climbs unsteadily back in. The limo pulls a INT. DETECTIVE GIGANTE’S HOUSE - BEDROOM. NIGHT. 116 Gigante lies in bed, sound asleep until his PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: Gigante... Yeah, I know that warehouse... So put out an APB. And don’t call again until you got ‘em. He hangs up and settles down again when his DOORBELL star to ring persistently. He gets up, grabs his GUN just in c INT. DETECTIVE GIGANTE’S HOUSE - HALLWAY. NIGHT. 117 Gigante opens the door to see: Frank. He’s a total wreck. Before Gigante can protest, Frank pushes into the hallway

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We gotta talk.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: What if someone saw you come?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Chris is dead, Vic. My son. That motherfucker burned down my warehouse and killed my son.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: Shit. I just got a call about Kickass... and the warehouse. Chris was in there?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Chris... Most of what was left of my men... You gotta help me.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: Okay, listen to me Frank. Good news is, there’s an APB out. Tonight we nail these superhero fuckers to the wall. Suddenly, the door bangs open and Chris, in his Red Mist costume, still holding the teddy, busts in and runs at Fr  71.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Holy shit!... Gigante goes for his gun... Then stares in total alarm as Frank and Red Mist hug one another.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .-.-You’re ok!

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (crying) They’re all dead, dad. We got there and all the guys were dead. Gigante, still confused, keeps the gun leveled at Red Mis

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Put the fucking gun down, Vic, it’s Chris!

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: Chris is Red Mist?!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It’s not Red Mist you gotta worry about, it’s Kickass!

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: But’s it’s not!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Kickass is just some geek! Its not him! You gotta watch this! Chris thrusts the teddy at them. Now they both look confu

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: I'm watching.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What’s it gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Aw, for fuck’s sake. I mean watch - (to Gigante) Where’s your DVD? 118 INT. GIGANTE’S HOUSE - FRONT ROOM. NIGHT. 118 Chris fumbles around, plugging the DVD cables into the te  120 121 72.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You bought this to spy on the nanny when I was a kid, don’t you remember?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Why’d you put it in the warehouse?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I guess I thought it’d be kinda cool to put the unmasking of Kickass on the net, okay? But look: The TV springs to life, and we see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same scene we saw: 10 armed goons. Huge Goon on his c

dialogues.speaker: HUGE GOON
dialogues.text: Just got an SMS. He’s on his way. Suddenly, Damon - in Big Daddy costume - appears behind h holding a hunting knife, and slices his face open. A beat, then a full scale fight begins, Big Daddy versus gangsters. Within moments, most have been shot or cut. INT. GIGANTE’S HOUSE - FRONT ROOM. NIGHT. 120 Gigante, Frank and Chris watch the TV, stunned. Reflected their eyes, we see the screen, lit up now with flames.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: Jesus... Who is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: He’s the real deal. INT. DAVE’S HOUSE - KITCHEN. DAY. 121 Dave and his dad eat breakfast in silence.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Superheroes who run into burning buildings are meant to find pretty ladies screaming “save my baby”. What they’re not meant to find is a pile of massacred corpses.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: You okay, buddy? You look tired. Get an early night tonight, maybe?  122 73.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You bet I will. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - KITCHEN. DAY. 122 A shaky Chris, school bag over his shoulder, rifles a she Frank slumps at the table, in the same suit as last night

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (shouting) Mom? Do we have any Tylenol? Angie, wearing a coat, pops her head round the door.

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: In my bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Angie! The fuck are you wearing a coat? Where’dya think you’re going?

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: The hair salon?

dialogues.speaker: PETE
dialogues.text: No, you're not! Nobody leaves this fucking building, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: ANGIE
dialogues.text: What? What’s wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to Chris) And you. Put down the goddamn school bag. You’re grounded.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Grounded?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Nobody comes in, nobody goes out! You both got it? I’m serious. I - Big Joe enters before Frank can continue.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: About time! Security fixed?

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Tighter than a nun’s chooch.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You watch your mouth in front of my fucking wife and kid! Angie, Chris and Joe swap nervous looks: Frank is losing  74.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Easy, Frankie. You’re safe. You got fifteen men here.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: And everybody else?

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Is out looking for this motherfucker. Just like you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus is whispering into his cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: They’re onto you. 124 INT. DAMON AND MINDY’S PLACE. DAY. 124 Damon is on his cell, cleaning his knife as he talks. Nea Mindy reads a COMIC. We intercut between the two men.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I thought they were looking for Kickass?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Not anymore. Gigante just put ona little movie show for us. Different Superhero. In a warehouse rinsing a whole bunch of D’Amico’s guys. I’m guessing that was you?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: ..-I killed all the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Apparently not. Better get yourself hid, bro.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Appreciate it. He hangs up and walks over to the wall with the pyramid o gangster pictures. Now all but the three topmost pictures have red Xs drawn through them. Damon reaches to the top Frank's picture and rips it from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mindy? Ditch the comic. It’s time for Frank D’Amico to go bye-bye.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: What, right now?  125 126 127 128 75.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: You bet. Tool up, honey bunny. Damon tosses the picture towards her. Mindy leaps up to reveal that she is wearing her utility belt.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Waaaay ahead of ya. So fast that we barely see the movement, she grabs a THRO STAR from the belt and skims it across the room. It catch the picture in mid air and - THUNK - pins it to the wall. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - HALLWAY. NIGHT. 125 - Through the open door to the study, we can see Frank ly comatose on his desk. Chris, carrying a PLASTIC BAG, look and tiptoes past. He passes Ginger Goon and salutes him before sneaking out the door. INT. D’AMICO’S APARTMENT BLOCK. CONTINUOUS. 126 Chris leaves the apartment and makes his way downstairs, ignoring the heavily-guarded elevator and taking the equa heavily-guarded stairs down to the underground parking lo EXT. D’AMICO’S APARTMENT BLOCK. CONTINUOUS. 127 Additional goons stand outside. Chris leaves on foot via parking lot entrance, unnoticed. Across the street we fin Damon and Mindy, parked up and lying low in their car. INT. DAMON’S CAR. CONTINUOUS. 128 Mindy presses her nose against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Daddy, I wanna go home.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: No, babydoll. He’s spooked right now. But it’s only been three days. He can’t stay in there forever.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: What if he can? Then what?

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I don’t know, hon. But I do know that if we go in there, we might never come out again. It'd be a gamble, Mindy baby.  129 76. Mindy thinks a while.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Well... I’m all in. Damon hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: I’m so proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sits in the passenger seat beside Chris. Both are in full costume. Chris is smoking a joint.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Like I said in my mail, I think I’m just... Done with all this.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I thought the same thing after the other night. But it’s kind of...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Addictive?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Exactly. Maybe we could forget the crime fighting. Just drive around. In our costumes, you know?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Dude, I really... I think there’s some messed up shit going on I don’t even wanna know about.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: How do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Like... I, I think I might know who killed those people at the warehouse. I think they’re on our side. But it’s major-league shit. I don’t wanna... Get mixed up in it.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: “They”? Like more than one person?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I don’t even wanna talk about it. I’m serious. I can’t say anything.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Kickass, you gotta tell me.  77. They pull up at a red light, and another car pulls up alongside, driven by two HOT CHICKS. who notice them immediately. Chris notices them back. Dave remains oblivi

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Look man, I just can’t. Chris elbows him and indicates the girls. The BLONDE in t passenger seat rolls down her window. Chris follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: O.M.F.G. Is it seriously you?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Red Mist. At your service. And this is, as I’m sure you know, Kickass. The BRUNETTE driver cranes for a better look and both gig

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: So what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: BRUNETTE
dialogues.text: We fucking love you guys, man. The light changes and Chris pull over. The girls pull up behind and get out, whispering to each other.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Ladies. Wanna ride in the Mistmobile?

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: That’s not all I wanna ride. Chris climbs into the back seat. The blonde follows him. The brunette gets into the driver’s seat. Dave waves at h awkwardly. In the back, the blonde is down to her bra.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNETTE
dialogues.text: Oh my god, this is so weird? Me and Jess were just saying last night how superheroes are so fucking horny? And now, like, we just see you guys out?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Uh... Wow. That is a coincidence. Imagine that. She giggles, climbs onto his lap and whispers in his ear.  130 78.

dialogues.speaker: BRUNETTE
dialogues.text: I want you so bad right now. Dave's eyes widen. Before he can speak, she silences him a kiss. Meanwhile, the blonde tries to remove Chris’ mask

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Uh-uh, baby. The mask stays on. (a beat) But the pants, knock yourself out. The blonde leans over to comply. Chris grins. Meanwhile, the front, Dave pulls away from the brunette.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I’m... I’m really sorry. I’m sure you're a lovely girl and, and, don’t get me wrong, I honestly think you're... so pretty and everything. But... I’ve got to go. Dave pushes the girl off as politely as he can and gets o of the car. The girl shrugs and climbs into the back seat with her friend and the now ecstatic Chris instead. And Dave hurries purposefully away down the street. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - STUDY. NIGHT. 130 Frank is freaking out. Ginger Goon cowers nervously.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m AWARE he’s not here. What I wanna know is WHERE THE FUCK HE IS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank throws an empty BOTTLE of whisky at the goon. He dodges, and it shatters against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: GINGER GOON
dialogues.text: Woah. Take it easy!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: The next fucker who tells me to take it easy dies.

dialogues.speaker: GINGER GOON
dialogues.text: Boss, I was... I’m sorry about your son, but all they said is make sure nobody gets in. I didn’t know we had to stop yer family gettin’ out.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Why are you still here? Just GO

dialogues.speaker: FUCKING FIND HIM
dialogues.text: 131 79. Big Joe walks in at the end of this tirade.

dialogues.speaker: BIG JOE
dialogues.text: Woah woah woah. Frank. Take it easy. Wrong move. Frank grabs Joe and throws him over his shoul Joe staggers to his feet. Frank strikes again with a leth karate blow to the throat. This time, Joe doesn’t get up. Frank sits down at his desk. The goon rushes to check on

dialogues.speaker: GINGER GOON
dialogues.text: Shit... he’s... dead.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What are you? A fucking doctor? And with that, he shoots the goon in the head. INT. KATIE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 131 Katie sits at her dressing table in nightclothes, brushin her hair. Her music is playing too loudly for her to hear Dave, outside the window - still in his Kickass costume - perched on the ledge and struggling to open the sash. Once in, he leans against the dresser, as coolly and sexi as he possibly can.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hi. I’m Kickass. You mailed me? Katie carries on brushing her hair. She hasn’t heard him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (louder) Hi! I’m - Katie leaps up, screaming hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shhh! Shhh! It’s just me! Kickass!

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Get away from me!! She grabs a bottle of BODY MIST from the dresser and spra it into his eyes. Dave crumples, clutching his face. Kati tosses the spray, grabs a TENNIS RACQUET and lays into hi

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Stop! Please! Katie! I’m not gonna hurt you! I really am Kickass!  80.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I don’t care! Fucking freak in a mask!? Breaking into my house?! At the same time, they both spot: a BASEBALL BAT.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Katie, no! They both lunge for it...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit! But Katie gets there first, tripping over the cable for h stereo as she does so, silencing the music. She pulls bac for a big swing at Dave. No choice: Dave pulls off his ma

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s me! Slowly, in disbelief, Katie lowers the bat.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Dave?! What are you doing? Why are you dressed as Kickass?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Because I am Kickass. And I’m also not gay. And I’ve been an idiot, and a shit friend, and I’ve lied to you, and if it makes you feel any better, I don’t think you could hate me any more right now than I hate myself. I’m just... Really, really sorry. I’ve never met anybody who was as beautiful and kind, and... and... lovely as you. And you deserve better. Katie stares at him as he walks towards the door to leave

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Dave...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (hopeful ) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: My mom set the burglar alarm downstairs. You should probably use the window.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Oh.  132 81. He turns despondently and starts towards the window. He’s just about to climb out when...

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Or... (a beat) You could just stay.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Really? She nods and sits down on the bed. He walks over uncertai

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay... Like when we have a sleepover? She shakes her head slowly, with a little smile. He sits down beside her and they kiss. Sweetly at first, then with a violent intensity that surprises them both. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - CORRIDOR. DAWN. 132 Chris grins as he does up his jeans. He stuffs his costum into the plastic bag as he sneaks back towards his room. At the study, he glances in to see: two corpses. And Fran making Jack Nicholson in The Shining look like Mary Poppi

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So. You wanna explain what part of “grounded” you found confusing?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: What... happened?! (noticing Joe) Oh my god... Joe?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Nobody comes in. Nobody goes out. It couldn't have been more fucking simple to understand.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You did this because of me? Frank looks away. Chris, touched, can’t suppress a smile.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think I know how to find this guy, dad. If we get him, everything will be like, okay again, won’t it? We can fix things together. Frank opens his arms and Chris walks over. And they hug.  133 134 82. INT. DAMON AND MINDY’S PLACE. DAY. 133 Damon and Mindy are surrounded by CRATES, BOXES, DIAGRAMS BLUEPRINTS. Both have laptops open. On Damon’s: links to CCTV cameras in D’Amico’s building. We can’t see Mindy’s.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Ain’t no man in the whole of Manhattan with bigger cojones than you, Mindy baby. You know that? But Mindy is engrossed in something on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Daddy, I think I found one. It’s perfect. And they can deliver in three days... But it’s three hundred thousand bucks.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Can you think of anything else you'd rather spend it on? Mindy giggles. Damon looks at her laptop screen in awe.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn, that’s cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave sits with Todd and Marty. Katie sits on Dave’s lap.

dialogues.speaker: TODD
dialogues.text: Out of Kickass and Red Mist, who do you think would win in a fight?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: No idea. But Kickass is definitely cuter.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Kickass is smokin’. I, for one, would definitely fuck his brains out if I got the chance. Todd and Marty look taken-aback by the newly raunchy Kati

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You would?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Definitely.  83. Dave and Katie look at one another hungrily.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Do you... uh, fancy checking out that new Kate Hudson movie where she’s a shoe designer who can’t get a guy? I think we can make the next showing if we leave right now.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Hell yeah. They leave, arms around each other. Todd and Marty exchan confused looks, then go back to reading their comics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Katie are at it, urgently, up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Comic-books rocked. Jerking off rocked. And being a superhero owned. But this... there was nothing - absolutely nothing - in the whole wide world that came close to being better than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 136 INT. DAVE’S HOUSE. NIGHT. 136 Dave and his dad are eating dinner together.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: No Katie tonight?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. Wednesdays she does one of her volunteer things.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LIZEWSKI
dialogues.text: You seem like a different guy, you know that? Your mom would've been so happy to see you out of your shell like this. 137 INT. DAVE’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 137 Dave is halfheartedly playing World of Warcraft.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Katie worried about me getting hurt, so I promised her my Kickass days were over. And the truth was, I hardly missed it at all. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I realised I hadn’t even checked the web site for, like, a week. Dave minimizes the screen and logs on to the KICKASS PAGE The button says: NEW MAIL: 45. Dave skims through the lis mails without reading any until he sees one from RED MIST EXT. DAVE’S APARTMENT. NIGHT. 138 Mr Lizewski, in uniform for his shift, gets into his car drives away. Seconds later, the door opens again to reveal: Dave. Whee his bike; wearing a duffle-coat over his Kickass costume, no mask. He’s just about to climb on when his cell rings.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie is behind a reception desk in a waiting room crowde with JUNKIES. Katie listens intently, her face clouding o

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: ...Where? What kind of a thing? I thought you were done with that? We now intercut between Katie and Dave.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: This is the last time. I totally swear... Well, I wish you wouldn't worry.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I can’t help it. I do. Because I... (is she gonna say it?) .«..Care about you. A lot. In the alley, Dave can’t control his giant smile.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I... care about you a lot, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mistmobile is parked in a deserted lay-by near the ri Dave rides up, hops off his bike and puts on his mask as approaches. Chris, in full Red Mist costume, opens the do  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave slides into the passenger seat - coat still on.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Serious and urgent had better mean serious and urgent, dude. I promised my girlfriend I was through with all this.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: How about us both being fucking dead? That serious enough for ya?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Dead how?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Like how it turns out those dead guys had some bad mother-fuckers for friends, and they think we did it. There’s a price on our heads.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: A price on our heads? What is this, the wild west?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I’m not messing with you, man. They found out where I live. They trashed my place. I’m fucked. And you'll be next. That guy you mentioned... The guy you thought did it? You said you figured he was on our side. You think he can help? Dave thinks. Sighs. Then uses his cell to get the Kickass page. Chris watches as Dave keys in: Kickass is on vacati

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s your plan?! Like they’re gonna go “aw shoot, he’s on vacation, let’s just forget it then”?! What the fuck!?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Dude... Calm down. 142 INT. DAMON AND MINDY’S PLACE. NIGHT. 142 Mindy is on her laptop. Damon studies an open packing cra

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: If I didn’t know you better, Daddy, I'd say you were just looking at that thing for the hell of it now.  143 144 145 86.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: (laughing) Just checking it one more time. You gotta admit, it’s pretty cool. From the laptop, an ELECTRONIC ALERT sounds. Damon looks

dialogues.speaker: DAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kickass?

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I think... Yep... Looks like he just triggered the emergency protocol you set up.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Tell him to go to safehouse B. We’ll meet him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris studies the screen on Dave’s phone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Do you know where that is?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I'll put it in the Sat-nav. Chris looks anxiously over his shoulder and starts the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The run-down corridor of a faceless apartment block. Chri and Dave (still wearing his duffle-coat) ring a doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open and Dave and Chris step in to be gre by Damon, in his Big Daddy costume.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Well, here you are. And Red Mist, too. Pleasure to meet you. (extending his hand) Big Daddy. Chris and Damon shake hands, and the boys follow Damon in the main room, where Mindy sits on the sill of the open window, looking out. She turns back, a little concerned.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: Manners, honey. Obediently, Mindy hops off the window sill.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Sorry. (extending her hand) I’m Hit Girl. She extends her hand but, before she can even walk over, before we even realize what’s happening, Chris has pulled GUN. He shoots Mindy three times - BAM BAM BAM - and she tumbles backwards, out of the window. Hit Girl is no more. Dave freezes in shock; Damon gives an animal howl of horr And now Chris holds the gun shakily to Damon's head.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Don’t move, motherfucker. The door behind them is kicked open and EIGHT GOONS rush Two grab Damon, two grab Kickass and within seconds they’ both on the ground, cuffed and gagged.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, not Kickass! He’s with me!

dialogues.speaker: SPORTY GOON
dialogues.text: Forget it, kid. I don’t follow orders from no one but your daddy. These guys are going with me, and you're going home with him. He indicates Scary Goon, who seizes Chris by the arm. And they’re out of the door with Damon, Dave and Chris in tow

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Shit! No! The Scary Goon holds him back as the others hustle on ahe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goons bundle Damon and Dave into the back of a VAN. Nearby, Scary Goon pushes a fighting Chris towards a LIMO Seeing Dave in the van, Chris shouts over to him, distrau

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean for this to happen, I swear! (to Scary Goon) Let me go with them, I have to tell them not to hurt Kickass!  88.

dialogues.speaker: SCARY GOON
dialogues.text: Just get in the goddamn car or your dad is gonna hurt both of us! Chris struggles as Scary tries to push him into the backs of the limo. In the scuffle, Chris’s mask comes off. We see Dave’s reaction. Then Sporty slams the van door sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damon and Dave are tied to chairs in the eerily charred warehouse. The former calm. The latter sobbing. There is PLASTIC SHEETING on the floor, and hanging behind them. I front of them is a DV CAMERA on a tripod. Nearby, Baby Goon hands out SUPER-VILLAIN MASKS. Sporty G looks at his in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: SPORTY GOON
dialogues.text: The fuck is this? I meant, like balaclavas or something!

dialogues.speaker: BABY GOON
dialogues.text: I just thought these would be fun.

dialogues.speaker: SPORTY GOON
dialogues.text: Fun?!

dialogues.speaker: BABY GOON
dialogues.text: You know, they’re like superheroes, so we could be -

dialogues.speaker: SPORTY GOON
dialogues.text: Just get me some fucking balaclavas! Or anything! Now!

dialogues.speaker: BABY GOON
dialogues.text: Can I still wear mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is here, also on the verge of tears.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: We had a deal, dad. We had a fucking deal that I’d get you the guy who did it. All I’m asking is to let Kickass go! He didn’t do anything wrong!  149 150 151 89.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Chris, you gotta look at it my way: I wanna send out a little public service message to warn the people out there that being a superhero is hazardous to your health. And the big motherfucker? Nobody's ever heard of him. For all Joe Schmo on the street knows, he’s not even a real superhero.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: But that’s not fair!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Life’s not fair, kid. Get over it.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do to them?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Shut up and watch. He indicates his computer SCREEN. On it is a DIGITAL CLOC counting backwards from 5 minutes. And a graphic saying: KICKASS IS RETIRING! HIS FINAL APPEARANCE - LIVE. We pull back to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that the graphic is now on a monitor behind a NEWS ANC

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR
dialogues.text: ...the exact nature of the broadcast, but as word-of-mouth continues to spread, internet providers are predicting that it could be the most-widely viewed live event in web history. We pull back from the news studio to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-It is playing on the TV in the comic store. Todd, Mart the other kids and store employees are crowded round in r anticipation. Many are logged onto the site on their phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large number of COPS, including Marcus and Gigante, are gathered around the TV and computers, curious.  152 153 154 155 156 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie sits behind the reception, looking at the site on a computer, a little uneasy. Nearby a TV runs the news, wat by the waiting junkies, except those who are nodding out. ON THE SCREEN: The countdown reaches zero. The graphic is replaced by a live feed. Kickass and Big Daddy, captive. Katie lets out a shriek of pure distress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As one, the kids and store employees react in abject shoc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goons crowd menacingly around their captives. All in balaclavas except Baby, who wears the supervillain mask. Sporty steps forward and addresses the camera.

dialogues.speaker: SPORTY GOON
dialogues.text: Uh... I think y’all know who this guy is. And this guy here, his name is Big Daddy. And what Kickass and Big Daddy are gonna demonstrate today, kids, is why trying to be a hero is a bad idea. The goons, armed with BATS and BLUNT WEAPONS, move in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As one, the crowd of cops wince. Marcus reacts in dismay.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: +..-mean we are unable to continue broadcasting these images...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are glued in stark horror. Some unable to look, unable to look away. A few of the girls start crying.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...and those who are logged on to the site are strongly advised...

dialogues.speaker: MATHLETE
dialogues.text: Woah! Cool! The crowd bays at him to shut up.  157 158 159 gl. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - STUDY. NIGHT. 157 Chris gets up in disgust and walks out, slamming the door

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: I hate you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie, her face streaked with tears and eye-makeup, leans over the desk and screams at the junkies.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Please! Someone just turn it off!

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...appears the fantasy story that captured America’s imagination may have what looks to be a tragic ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sporty Goon holds up his hand for the others to stop the beating. Dave and Damon slump forward, breathing unevenly

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Even with my metal plates and my fucked up nerve endings, I’ve gotta tell ya: that hurt.

dialogues.speaker: SPORTY GOON
dialogues.text: Gentlemen? Time to die. He produces a can of GASOLINE, and begins to douse them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But not half as much as the idea of leaving everything behind. Katie. My dad. Todd and Marty. And all the things I’d never do. Like learn to drive. Or see what me and Katie’s kids would look like. Or find out what happened in Lost. Sporty produces a ZIPPO and flicks it open.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And if you’re reassuring yourself that I’m gonna make it through this since I’m talking to you now, quit being such a smart ass. Hell dude. You never seen Sin City? Sunset Boulevard? American Beauty?  160 161 162 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on THREE BULLET HOLES. A little finger pokes them. pull back to find: Mindy. The top of her costume hiked up she can examine her kevlar vest. She shrugs, pulls her costume back down and reaches round the back of her utility belt. She produces a small packag On it is written: FOR EMERGENCIES ONLY. She tears it open. She pulls out a piece of PAPER that re

dialogues.speaker: IF ANYTHING HAPPENS TO ME, CALL MARCUS. 212 555 7407
dialogues.text: Then she pulls out: a syringe. She plunges it into her ar Close on Mindy’s eye. Her pupil dilates, a black vortex. She puts on a pair of NIGHT VISION GOGGLES and - like a s colorful, deadly tornado - she leaps down from the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The zippo lighter touches Damon. At once he’s in flames. A small hand hits a light switch. And everything goes bla Dimly lit by the screaming Damon, alight, we can see the goons look to one another in puzzlement. Seconds later, Hit Girl is all over them. We cut between night-vision POV and the eerily beautiful darkness illuminated by her burning father as, one by one, she sli and dices the hoods into submission. She’s taking a few h sure, but she appears to be utterly oblivious to them. Last man down, Mindy runs to Damon and beats out the flam All is black now. We hear footsteps as she runs to the li ON A COMPUTER SCREEN: The dark image of the room lights u The tripod must have been knocked during the fight, so wh we see now is several dead goons and, in the corner of th frame, a shocked - but very alive - Kickass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mindy pulls a gun from her belt and levels it at the came

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Show’s over, motherfuckers. BAM. It explodes into pieces.  163 164 165 166 167 168 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On several dozen phone screens, the image goes BLACK. The store erupts in celebration. What the hell just happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confusion and noise. Gigante and Marcus both look shaky.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...exactly what happened, but it would seem that Kickass, at least, is alive. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - STUDY. NIGHT. 165 Frank stares at the TV, catatonic with incredulity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie reacts with near-hysterical relief. In sharp contra to the junkies, who continue to stare impassively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blinking in the light, Mindy runs to Damon. But as her st slow and her face falls, we surmise that the sight greeti her isn’t good. And we're right: we need no medical degre make a grim prognosis for the thoroughly fried Damon.

dialogues.speaker: DAMON
dialogues.text: So proud of you, baby. I love you. He closes his eyes. His eyelids are the only things that aren’t burned. Mindy plants a gentle kiss on one of them.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I love you too Daddy. Sleep tight. And he’s gone. Her face set in a brave show of stoicism, Mindy moves briskly to the traumatised Dave and unties hi

dialogues.speaker: MINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s get the hell outta here. EXT. DAMON’S CAR. NIGHT. 168 Mindy and Dave arrive at the car. Dave has removed his ma

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I... I can’t drive.  94.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I can. Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two drive through Manhattan, battered and shell-shock Mindy can barely see over the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What’s your name? I mean, your real name.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: A superhero never reveals his true identity.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Look, you can’t... However you lived before... It’s over. Is there anybody else? Any other family, or?

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Fuck you! I can take care of myself. I saved your sorry ass!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: But I mean, what about money? You've got to think long-term -

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I've got three million dollars ina fucking suitcase! That long-term enough for ya? Just leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere ‘til i know you're okay. I owe you. If it wasn’t for you, I'd be dead.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: And if it wasn’t for you, my dad wouldn’t be.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (a painful beat) .-..-And I owe it to him to look after you. He wouldn’t have wanted you to be on your own. 170 INT. DAMON AND MINDY’S PLACE. NIGHT. 170 The door opens into the dark. Mindy hits the light.  171 172 95. The first thing they see, pinned to the wall, is the Hit and Big Daddy picture that Damon did for Mindy’s birthday They both stare at it. A sad, awkward moment. Dave, holding MARCUS’S NUMBER, breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: We should call this number your dad gave you.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Not now. I’1l do it later, okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Ok... Look, pack up whatever you need. And we’ll go to my place. I'll figure out something to tell my dad when he gets back from his night shift. I need to clean up? INT. DAMON AND MINDY’S PLACE - BATHROOM. NIGHT. 171 It’s grimy. Dave rinses the blood from his face and hair. INT. DAMON AND MINDY’S PLACE. NIGHT. 172 Like a tiny Rambo, Mindy begins to tool up, weighing up RIFLES and HANDGUNS, sharpening KNIVES with a WATER STONE We intercut between her and Dave’s clean up until finally Dave walks out of the bathroom to find Mindy fully tooled and shoving additional WEAPONS into an OVERNIGHT BAG.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Woah. I meant, like pyjamas and stuff. And clothes. You can’t...

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: You know what my dad would have wanted? He would have wanted me to finish what we started. And that’s what I’m gonna do. You can try and stop me. Or live. Your choice. Dave looks around. Blueprints and plans. CCTV feeds on th laptop. Picture of Frank, pinned to the wall by a shurike

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Frank D’Amico?

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I know who he is.  96.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: My dad said Jersey City used to be a real nice safe place to raise a family. Then D’Amico started up his little business enterprise. Flooded the street with cheap drugs. Armed the gangs. Bought-off the cops. Dave squints at the CCTV footage on the laptop, then look over at the plans again. Mindy continues to assemble a gu

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: This is his place? All this security? I don’t even see -

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Let him go, the whole thing starts up again. New guys. New supplies. All our hard work, wasted.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I know, but this plan of yours. Even if there were ten of you -

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: My mom already died for nothing. I’m not gonna let my dad die for nothing too.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You can’t do this on your own. It’s suicide.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Exactly. You wanna deal with owing my dad? Then shut the fuck up and pick your weapon. Mindy opens the big crate. Dave gapes at its contents.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: That what I think it is?

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Damn straight. Better start reading the instructions, cos you’re gonna be using it in about five minutes. Dave picks up his duffle coat and his mask. He looks at b Then he puts on his coat and shoves the mask in the pocke He shakes his head at her sadly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'd do anything to bring your dad back, if I could. Anything. But nothing will. And if I... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are people back home who... Hit Girl, I’m so sorry. I can’t do this.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Some fucking superhero. He shrugs helplessly, nothing he can say. She watches him The camera tracks in to the laptop showing the CC TV feed pull out again and find... 173 INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - LIVINGROOM. NIGHT. 173 ..+.-The bodyguard - the one we first saw with Chris at t comic store - watching the same images on D’Amico’s monit Suddenly, the screens go DEAD. He reacts. What the fuck?! 174 INT. D’AMICO’S APARTMENT BLOCK -LOBBY. NIGHT. 174 Posh Goon and ANOTHER GOON, on guard, look confused as Mi innocent in her street clothes - stumbles in, crying.

dialogues.speaker: POSH GOON
dialogues.text: Hey? What’s the matter?

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I lost my mommy and daddy. Another hood steps forward and offers his cell.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER GOON
dialogues.text: You wanna use the phone? You know your phone number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave stands on a rooftop, gazing out towards the Manhatta skyline. No mask. But no duffle-coat either.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Had I ever been a real superhero? The most I'd ever had to offer the world was good intentions and a slightly elevated capacity to take a kicking. (a beat) With no power comes no responsibility. (another ) Except... that wasn’t true. Dave pulls on his mask. And he starts to run.  176 177 178 179 180 98. Faster and faster. Towards the edge of the building. He reaches the edge... and this time, he doesn’t stop. He ju There is no way he’s going to make it to the next rooftop way anyone could make this jump. Dave begins to lose momentum. He starts to drop... ..-Until the JET PACK on his back kicks in. Dave swoops upwards. He’s flying. Dave soars. Over the water. Across New York. It’s beautif From the streets and windows people gawp in delight. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - LOBBY. NIGHT. 176 Mindy unleashes hell as she wastes the goons in the lobby We intercut between her fight and Dave’s flight. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - ELEVATOR. NIGHT. 177 Mindy - still in her street clothes - pushes the button f the penthouse and catches her breath. The door closes - t jams. She looks down to see that it is blocked by the bod Posh Goon. She boots him out of the way and the door shut INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - HALLWAY. NIGHT. 178 The elevator doors slide open to reveal: Mindy in her Hit Girl costume and utility belt. Ready to play. EXT. D’AMICO’S APARTMENT BLOCK. NIGHT. 179 Dave is here. Swooping up the side of the building. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - HALLWAY. NIGHT. 180 The TWO GOONS guarding either side of the elevator are do But EIGHT MORE rush down the corridor towards Mindy. She doesn’t move, but with jaw-dropping precision, employ the contents of her utility belt. THROWING STARS, KNIVES GRENADES whistle through the air, taking down six hoods i quick succession. A MACHETE spins down the length of the corridor, neatly decapitating a seventh. The eighth looks behind him in dismay as he keeps running towards Mindy, to discover that he’s now alone. When he t back, Mindy 1s right there in front of him, a small CROSS to his forehead. She grins and delicately lets it go. Thw  181 99. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE. CONTINUOUS. 181 Mindy’s inside the apartment now, and YET MORE GOONS are down, but two remain - Scary Goon, and the Bodyguard, als armed. They open fire. She’s leaping around, absorbing th hits in her bulletproof vest, until she trips and falls. Scary Goon aims at her head... but he’s out of ammo.

dialogues.speaker: SCARY GOON
dialogues.text: In the head! She’s wearing a fucking vest! The bodyguard raises his gun... but before he can shoot, there’s an almighty smash from behind them as the GLASS CONSERVATORY leading to the roof terrace explodes in a sh of glass to reveal: Dave coming in to land, opening fire a machine gun in each hand. The recoil sends him tumbling onto his back on the terrace. But he keeps shooting. The bodyguard and Scary have barely had a chance to turn register before they get it in the back and go down cold. Mindy’s smile lights up. Dave smiles back. Mindy limps ov

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Gimme the guns?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: We’re out of bullets!

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: (sniggering) Rounds. Ok. Only one to go, anyway. She runs towards the corridor. Dave throws down the now- useless guns and follows her. Mindy reaches the first door, kicks it in. It’s a bedroom see Angie, cowering in a corner. Mindy takes a step in wh outside, we hear SIRENS. Her face falls.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You called the cops.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I called the number. Your dad’s friend. Told him to meet us. He -

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: He is the fucking cops. In a hurry now, Mindy turns her back on Angie and runs on the next door, Dave racing to catch up. She kicks it open It’s Frank’s study. The motherlode.  182 100. INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - STUDY. CONTINUOUS. 182 A beat, as Frank stands in the middle of the trashed stud and stares at Mindy. Dave catches up just in time to see Mindy fly at him.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: You are so dead, you cocksucker. With his martial arts skills, Frank is an alarmingly even match for Mindy. Dave watches, frozen. This could go eith way. Dave moves to help, but finds himself held back by: Chris. Still in his Red Mist costume, though without the mask. Behind Dave, forcing him into an arm-lock. Now we have two fights going on - Mindy vs. Frank and Dav vs. Chris. The former a spectacular display of fighting prowess, the second essentially a messy scrap between two frightened kids in superhero costumes. Just as it looks like Mindy is a goner, she regains the u hand with breath-taking aplomb and sends Frank crashing through the window, down 70 storeys to his death. Chris stops fighting and howls in horror.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Chris) Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: No, wait please, I never... Please don’t hurt me. I’m just a kid.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: So am I, and you fucking shot me!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Chris, you don’t have to be like your Dad. You have a choice, you -

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: How do you know my name?! Before Dave can answer, Mindy has a knife to Chris’s thro

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Enough with the touchy-feely bull- shit already.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No! Wait! Don’t! It’s not this that stops her, however, but THE COPS. A sizeable team of them, crashing in towards them, armed.  183 184 101.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST COP
dialogues.text: Freeze! Police! Chris and Dave put their hands up immediately. Mindy, however, goes for a STUN GRENADE in her belt. Before anyo has a second to react, it’s landed by the cops and gone o In the fog and confusion, Mindy grabs Dave’s hand. They r EXT. D’AMICO’S ROOF TERRACE. NIGHT. 183 Mindy helps Dave into the jet pack and puts her arms roun him. Just as the cops get to the terrace, the two take of One cop takes aim at them. Suddenly a shout from behind h

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hold your fire! It’s Marcus. He smiles as he watches them disappear over horizon like Superman and a very tiny Lois Lane. Finally he turns to go inside, the smile still on his fac to find: Gigante, incandescent with anger.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: You'll go down for that, Williams! Your ass is going straight to tribunal! I’1l see to it myself. Marcus grins and produces a framed photograph. He admires

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh this is nice. You look awesome.

dialogues.speaker: GIGANTE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Just found this on D’Amico’s desk. Isn't this a great shot, guys? Marcus shows the picture around to the assembled cops, wh react in delighted shock. Gigante reels. He knows it’s ov

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hope Frank D’Amico paid you well, Gigante. You’re gonna be needing one fine-ass lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave and Mindy land on the roof of Mindy’s building.  185 102.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Kickass. My dad would have been proud of both of us. Dave pulls his mask off meaningfully.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Dave. My name is Dave Lizewski.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY
dialogues.text: I know that, dumbass. A long pause. Then Mindy pulls off her mask, too.

dialogues.speaker: MINDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mindy Macready. She holds out her hand, and they shake hands. It’s over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lizewski’s car pulls up outside the school. Dave clim out and waves goodbye to him. As Dave begins to walk, he turns around to see ANOTHER CA pull up. Driven by Marcus. In the passenger seat, Mindy. Marcus hugs her and she hops out and runs over to Dave.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mindy moved in with Marcus and he enrolled her at my school - first school she’d ever been to - on the promise that I’d look out for her. Before she reaches him, however, a BIG MEAN BOY and his T CRONIES block Mindy’s path. He holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BIG MEAN BOY
dialogues.text: Hey. New kid. Lunch money. Now. We cut to Dave’s concerned face. 0.S, there’s a scream. When we cut back to Mindy, she’s once more trotting happi towards Dave, waving, as if nothing has happened. In the background a CONCERNED CROWD has formed a circle around whatever carnage Mindy left.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not that she needed me to. Marty and Todd are sitting in the sunshine, reading comic Dave and Mindy join them, Mindy checking out the comics.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The guys never knew about what happened. And Katie? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, besides being deeply relieved that my superhero days were over, Katie was the same as ever. From the other direction, we see Katie walking over with Erika and a slightly chubby, FLAMBOYANTLY-DRESSED GUY.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Hey everybody, this is Phil. He’s new. Phil, this is everybody. Marty, Todd, Dave and Mindy all wave their greetings.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ---And I loved her for it. Katie and the boy sit down with the group. Dave rests his head on Katie’s shoulder. We’ve never seen him so content In the foreground, TWO LABORERS walk past carrying the me detector archway away from the school.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But the world around us was changing. We pull back a little to see: the two gang kids from earl peering into a parked car at the entrance to the school. FOXY WOMAN IN A SUPERHERO COSTUME walks towards them. The nod at her shiftily and amble away. We pull back further and see: the streets around the scho are patrolled by various other SUPERHEROES.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: People said I’d been the inspiration for the others. But I saw it differently. We pull back further still, across the water, to Manhatta Here’s the Armenian Guy from the beginning, in his winged suit, climbing up the fire escape of a building. There ar SUPERHEROES everywhere. Walking the streets. Running acro the cars in a traffic jam. Leaping across the rooftops.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All I did was make a door into a world I’d dreamed about since I was a little kid. Now it was open. And the world was coming out. We pull upwards now, further and further back, ‘til the superheroes are just brightly colored dots on the streets

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That’s how it looked to me. And I liked what I saw.  186 187 104. Just as we think it’s all over, the camera pushes through window into... INT. D’AMICO’S PENTHOUSE - STUDY. DAY. 186 The study has been restored and redecorated, and there’s someone sitting here with his back to us, admiring his reflection in the glass-topped table. The camera tracks round and we see: Chris. A crazy look i his eyes, wearing a new, more menacing costume. He slips an evil-looking mask. Clearly a super-hero no more, now a super-villain. He turns to stare down onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: A world full of superheroes, huh? As a great man once said: “wait ‘til they get a load of me”. FADE TO WHITE.
